Buyer beware!  The item shipped is not the one pictured.  It is a much cheaper made version. I own the original version of this faucet,which is the one pictured.  I was actually trying to match it.  Also, after three days it started to leak through the handle. Upon disassembling it I discovered that the insert is no longer made of brass, but some flimsy plastic, like a toy. This faucet is junk.

I have had this item for about a year and it worked great. Then this morning I could not turn off the water. After filling a container that we place in the refrigerator the water would not turn off from this faucet. I thought maybe I could repair it with an O-ring or something but it does not appear that I can do anything. "This stinks."

I was really looking forward to getting these, but they just seem to feel like something only a dentist should be responsible for using.  The quality is great and they look fantastic.... but I can't use them without getting the "creeps".
summary: Can't put my finger on it but it just feels weird.

reviewText: I bought one just like this from Starbucks and promptly chipped my front tooth!  I found a hard plastic straw & cut about a half inch off of it and stuck it on the end of the metal straw. The plastic is definitely softer than the metal.
summary: YOU MAY CHIP A FRONT TOOTH ON METAL STRAWS!!

reviewText: The product should be called "De-Shorty" instead of Delonghi since none of their products seem to last more than a few months or at best a year.  The Iron has so many design flaws that it is not worth the $172.00 it cost.  It has no water level, the hose is too short and spits hot water, there is no way of knowing if it is on or off, and it doesn't last very long.  The Delonghi electric cheese grater lasted only one month and the coffee maker less than 6 weeks.  I will never buy another Delonghi.

They didn't work.  First they are a pain to put on.  Then once you have them on, they fly off.  After you finally get them on and they stay on, once you lay down they all fly off.  And they ship from China, that's why it takes so long for them to arrive.

This is a VERY poor product--it does not do what the manufacture claims it does.  The snaps are poorly constructed of cheap plastic and do not hold the sheets in place for any time whatsoever.  Very frustrating to try and use.  By the time I got the second strap snapped, the first one had already released.  This happened over and over again, until I finally gave up.

I made the mistake of not looking at the reviews and when I got them they were absolute rubbish.  The package was torn open and the suspenders don't attach to the fitted sheet at all.  For anyone who sews I suggest that you just do what I'm doing - sew some permanent elastics onto your fitted sheets so you never have to worry about attaching them again.

I had some of these grippers at one time that worked and worked well.  This set, however, came apart while putting them on the sheets for the first time.  I couldn't use them, so even though they were cheap it was a waste of time and money getting them.
summary: Fell apart while attaching them to the sheets

reviewText: The clasps are awkward and hard to implement. They will stay in place if you can get them on, but that is only possible on standard sheets. Anything heavier than that and it's futile. Will not work on flannel sheets at all. The metal parts are cheap and flimsy. You will need a pair of pliers handy to bend things back into place when using for sure. I just ended up tossing them. I wouldn't take another set if they were free.

Do Not Buy!!!!
The unit failed after one week of operation just like the other reviewers mentioned.  It's a shame, it worked well at first and I thought it was really going to be useful.  The unit was never abused and was only run while it was sitting in the crankcase.  It's just a piece of junk.

What a waste of money!  Totally did not work, red squirrels, grey squirrels and chipmunks were not bothered in the least.  Seemed like it was just simple water in the bottle.  Don't bother with this product.

We use food grade DE as a pest control product. The DE used in pool filters contains crystallized silica and is NOT food grade, and NOT safe to use around food or even to breathe.  Someone is trying to make a buck because the pool filter DE is cheaper than the food grade DE.

[...]

[...]

Check the links.

I purchased this "credit card case" and tried putting my cards in it. It will only hold a handful of cards, and if you want one, you are going to have to take them all out and sort through them. For holding so few cards it is also fairly bulky. I could return it, but I have to pay return shipping and a 15% restocking fee, so it is hardly worth it. This would probably be fine for business cards, but I would not call it a credit card holder.
summary: Have to remove all cards to get one out.

reviewText: The Weed Thrasher is a low-quality product that does not deliver what it advertises.  The nylon cutters wear down quickly, prompting you to install new ones far too frequently.  I recommend reading the reviews listed for the Weed Thrasher unit.  It is simply a waste of money.
summary: There is a reason why you have to buy so many refills...

reviewText: I was able to fill the tube with spores just fine and it works in principle. The problem that I saw is that the plastic disc with the holes is made from soft material and bends. When the tube is filled all the way with spores, the weight of the powder pushes the disk out so that it is impossible to control the amount of milky spores that you are dispensing. Just use a spoon, it is easier and much more accurate.
summary: I do not recommend using this

reviewText: I purchased 2 of these units as I thought they would be better than the shelf unit on the tension rod.  However, none of them have stayed up more than 3 days at a time. I have put them up 4 times now and the record is 3 days. I think I will have to go back and get another tension rod unit - at least those units will stay put!

The surface of this pad is like velvet.  In my opinion, that's not a good surface for a mousepad.  There's just too much friction.

I also have an odd aversion to velvet - whenever I stroke anything velvet, it feels like nails on a chalkboard for me.  I wish I'd known that this thing was velvety.

I ordered 2 of these phones because I am having trouble finding this type phone in any local store. Needless to say - neither of the phones worked. On one phone the mouthpiece did not work.  On the other, the handset had buttons that did not work at all.
So I returned both of the phones.

I bought this phone because I wanted something simple and corded. This phone worked great for the first few months, then the caller ID stopped working and now when I call someone or they call me they can barely hear me (although I hear them ok). The sound quality is very poor and I need to get this phone replaced. A waste of money!
summary: Worked for a few months only

reviewText: The idea of thes little vacuum cleaner is so wonderful.  It was exactly what we were looking for to take along in our RV.  It did an ok job cleaning up but...  When we thought it was time to clean out the vacuum we couldn't get it open.  Now it's full and we can't use it anymore.  Bummer!
summary: We can't get it open to clean it out.

reviewText: I got this for my camper late this Summer.  I have used it a few times and it only picks up some very LIGHT dirt and dog fur.  I got it to keep the pebbles off the floor so as to save the floor from wear and tear.  It will not pick up anything the size of a small pinhead or bigger.  There seems to be very little suction.  I have gone back to sweeping because I can do a better job with a broom than this (so called) vacuum cleaner.  Sorry, I'd like to give it a better score but just can't.
summary: Hate is a strong word, I dislike it

reviewText: This is a poor quality lightweight vacuum.  It hardly picks up dust and lint,  and you can forget about picking up hair or other small items from rugs and floors with this vacuum.  I am disappointed with its performance.  I would not recommend it to anyone.  Pay a little more for a better product because it's not even worth the $25 I paid for it.

This organizer is just cheaply made.  And, it's not very good for holding remotes.  I have five remotes, but one of them I use all the time so I thought a holder for four would be a good idea.  One of my remotes is pretty small.  It's the only one that fits well into this organizer.  It's not very convenient to use.  And that's supposed to be the reason you're buying this kind of a product.

I had a different model of DeLonghi heater for my home that does an incredible job heating large rooms, so I figured another DeLonghi product with less wattage would be fully capable of heating a small office - it is not, don't waste your money.
summary: Poor Quality Item for such a great brand.

reviewText: Someone mentioned that there was a slight "click" when the thermostat kicks in...well, our newly arrived heater woke the entire family from  another room with its click, click, clicking. I dozed back off for a while only to be awoken again a short while later. This went on in a continuous cycle for a few hours. Finally I went and turned it off. It is a torment to my sleep and therefore worthless to me.

55 hours?  No way.  Well, maybe if you keep trimming the wick to a tiny size.  But I let this candle burn continuously and it lasted no longer than 24 hours and melted all over the place.  Not worth it at all.

The capability of this thing to filter air and odors is weaker than waving a dishtowel around in a burning kitchen. You're better off opening the windows and waving your hat around. It would do a better job of clearing out smells.

Haven't used it yet, but the construction of this is solid. Im sure when the time comes that this will work like a champ.

Updated 9/27/2013

Had to get rid of this and buy one of better quality from Home Depot. At first it seemed solid, however when I put it to use, it ended up bending due to the force needed to turn the water meter. Fortunately, this didn't happen in an emergency situation. It might work if your water meter is easy to turn, however, mine needed some coercing to turn. Save your money.

The reel thing doesn't work well at all, as others have noted, but I didn't mind that so much. What I did mind was that the hose itself is rather delicate. I was using it with the included nozzle, and when the nozzle was shut off, the hose ruptured from the water pressure. This on the third time of using it. This must have happened to many other users, making me wonder how it can still be on the market.

Great hose, lightweight and doesn't kink, but very cheap fittings. The first time I used it, I pulled a little too hard and it broke off at the faucet.  Obviously a hose is worthless if you can't connect it to anything. I bought this hose once locally for $8, and it lasted about a year and a half before it started leaking, and I've been trying to find another one.  This one felt like the same hose, but the fittings make it a zero.

I had to return this product, simply because I was not able to assemble it. None of the pieces are labeled; even trial-and-error failed to get it together. The instructions are drawings of the pieces and the hardware. I called in my $25-an-hour handyman; after two hours, we still did not have anything put together. It is a very attractive storage unit, and it arrived in great shape. I just couldn't get it put together.
summary: and it arrived in great shape. I just couldn't get it put together

reviewText: What a waste of money. I tried using this in many different ways but each time the squirrels easily figured it out. if it wasn't so frustrating it would be funny.  At least the dogs had fun. Right before I got rid of it I think I had every squirrel in the county in my backyard.

Purchased this kerosene pump about a month ago and it worked well until last night when it started leaking right below the battery housing I was none too happy when kerosene started pouring all over the floor. Would not recommend this pump unless this one that I received is just a defective unit. I have used battery powered kerosene pumps in the past and have never seen one leak like this.
summary: Started leaking after 1 month of use

reviewText: I bought this item for my wedding and when it arrived it was missing multiple key parts to put this thing together. The pieces that it did come with were cheaply made and it didn't seem sturdy. It was hell returning this thing and getting a replacement - which did not arrive in time for my wedding. When the replacement did arrive (well after my wedding) I shoved it in a cabinet and haven't looked at it since. I wish I would have never bought the piece of crap...
summary: Came too late for my wedding with missing parts...

reviewText: I was not satisfied with produce at all.  I send it back as soon as I open the box. I didn't like the way it looked at all.  If you are having a kiddie party with no more than 10 kids then I guess it would work.

At first I loved this fountain. I used it for my kids birthday party. Afterwards I washed it exactly how the instructions told me to, and put it back in the box after it dried. I went to use it a few months later, and it didn't work. The liquid never flowed out of the fountain again...I was very disappointed as well as the kids.

The one I have doesn't work at all, so I opened it up. The total price of all the components has to be less than $5, which makes $35 a rather outrageous purchase price. The components are the case, the probes, the meter, a 50 cent rheostat, a switch, a small photo cell, and a resistor. I can't see how that meager melange is supposed to produce meaningful results.

No matter where you stick it, it reads 7. It's a simple matter to read pH, so I don't understand why this doesn't work at all. Look on the Internet and you'll see several ways to test pH using ordinary household items. pH is the most important thing to know, as it determines which chemicals may be locked up in the soil unavailable to the plant; plus, some plants require out-of-the-ordinary pH.

I can't give this item a low enough rating as to me it is  pure  junk. I followed the directions to the letter but failed to get any kind of reading. In fact one of the prongs fell out the first time I tried to use it.

We bought it primarily to test for acidity (pH) but found it to be wildly inaccurate. Immersed in liquid detergent it read 6.8, which is too low for something so alkaline, and immersed in distilled vinegar (5% acid) it read 4.1, which is well above the correct value of 2.4. We're sending it back and will try a different model.

On the first day of setting this up we had a squirrel on the bird feeder, within one hour the birdfeeder was empty. This does not stop our squirrels from getting to the feeder. I will be returning it immediately.
summary: Does not work and is not worth any money.

reviewText: Maybe this works okay for a pole-mounted bird feeder, but it does NOT work for a hanging feeder.  It took the squirrels two tries to figure it out.  I'm not a big fan of giving negative reviews, but this is worthless for hanging feeders

I bought a small birdfeeder on Amazon and had problems protecting it from the squirrels. I purchased this Audubon shield to see if that would solve the problem. Don't kid yourself.  Within hours the squirrels were back. I tried turning the shield over hoping that it would be more unstable and consequently more difficult. Same result!  I hope I can get my money back.

This item consists of five components. Is it really that difficult to make sure ALL of them are in the box before shipping? Used once and then tossed in the trash; not even worth the hassle of returning. A complete waste of time, money and energy. Thanks for nothing Nostalgia Electrics!

This item is really beautiful.  When I recieved it I immediately plugged it in to try it out and it worked great.  So I unplugged it and put it back into the box.  The day I planned on using it to keep already cooked hot dogs warm and on display for customers at a charity event.  Well it never heated up when I took it out of the box the second time.  Too late to send it back so oh well I am stuck with it.  It is really pretty but that is the extent of the functionality I have found for this product.

Took this out of the box, plugged it in, and waited 45 minutes for it to heat up enough to cook hot dogs. After this adventure, I put it back in the box and returned it for a refund.  Find another brand, this one is worthless

I bought this for an old Dremel tool that does not have variable speed control. With this speed controller, I still had an old Dremel without variable speed control. It simply did not work. Thank goodness for Amazon. I returned the item the very next day without a fuss. I do not recommend this item. I was able to solve my problem using a sewing machine foot pedal that actually worked 100 times better than this product.

I bought this because I had purchased the Kyocera ceramic knives and they are of superior quality; I love them.  The mandoline, on the other hand, is not well constructed at all.  There is no way to adjust the thickness of the cut such that it's not paper thin.  Poorly designed and poorly executed.
summary: Doesn't deserve the Kyocera name plate

reviewText: The 3-millimeter setting produces slices that are 0.5 millimeters wide. The 0.5-millimeter setting doesn't slice at all. This is a cheap plastic product, and clearly it's a bit of a crapshoot: maybe the manufacturing of your unit will go OK and you'll get a mandoline that works, or maybe you'll get a piece of crap that seems wildly over-priced even at $20. You won't know for sure until you open the box.
summary: You get what you pay for - and sometimes not even that

reviewText: I bought this fountain last week through Amazon. It looks nice but the pump does not work. I called customer service and they instructed me to manually start the pump - which I did 10 times. As soon as I put the pump in the water it shuts off. This is not a reliable product.

I installed six of these valves in a manifold 4 months ago.  Three of the six have already failed.

I have been attempting to contact RainBird customer service for over two weeks.  Every time I call I get one of two messages, both of which state that RainBird can't take my call at the moment, and then hang up on me.

I put this on a shelf in our small laundry room. Can't smell it at all when I'm in there. The jar and little balls have a great aroma when I hold it to my nose but the fragrance doesn't seem to waft out of the jar.

The bolt is obviously not hardened steel and as it wears, it makes removal very difficult. Because of the way it is manufactured, you cannot replace it with a hardened steel bolt. Made to fail, but not Amazon's fault. The manufacturers has designed it to fail.
summary: The bolt is obviously not hardened steel and as it ...

reviewText: My first problem is that the Table Mate did not come in the color I ordered, but since it will spend a lot of time in storage, it wasn't worth the effort to return it.  The table itself is cheap looking.  If I had seen it in person before purchasing it, if I had bought it at all I wouldn't have paid more than $15 for it.  I bought it to use for a laptop PC that I'll begin to use next month, so I cannot yet comment how it will work out.  It's clearly not an item you would want to use for guests.

This is the second Table-Mate product I have purchased.  The first was solid, steady and well made.  When I saw Table-Mate II in the description, I assumed it was a more advanced and better version of the table I already have.  Flimsy doesn't even cover it.  It barely stands up on its own.  If you look at it, it will fall over.  It is no exaggeration to say it is worthless.
summary: Don't buy this table.  If you do, you will be outraged.  It is worthless.

reviewText: Broke putting it together. 3 of the shelves collapsed. This isn't wood. It's that terrible particle board. Not to mention, one of the corners was dented and didn't align straight out of the box for the long pieces. I don't think I can even put it together now. It's garbage. Don't waste your money. I thought it would be better than that terrible Walmart furniture. It's not.

The item came with scratches and wood chips all over the shelves. I never even got to unpacking the whole item for assembly. The first shelf I picked up had some oil smeared on the back and the front side was all chipped. The one shelf underneath it also had other marks that could not be removed. I reread the reviews and other customers have also reported similar issues. STAY AWAY FROM THIS ITEM.

I was so excited to find this shelf at half the cost of those on other websites....well there is a reason for the price. This is a huge piece of junk. It will not go together and the shelves won't even hold a coffee cup let alone be used as an actual shelf. Crappy product, save your time and spend the extra money on something that will actually go together properly and can be defined as a "shelf"

I wish I could give this bookshelf zero stars. While it arrived on time, when I opened the box, I immediately noticed dents and scratches all over the bookshelf that the manufacturer colored red (the bookshelf itself is espresso color). I have no clue why they would color it red to cover it up. Also, they sent me two of the same side bars so I was unable to put the bookshelf together. Overall, terribly unhappy with the bookshelf. It's going back.
summary: Missing parts and scratches all over

reviewText: It is pretty comfy the first few nights, but then the feathers start coming out everywhere.  They stick you in the back and end up all over the room.  My cat has taken to eating the feathers as a snack.  It is pretty sad.  I may end up just taking it off the bed altogether.

This is by far the worst product I have ever purchased.  Not only do the feathers come out but the quill of the feather comes out first, so it's like sleeping on a bed of pins.  They are hard and they are sharp!  I am extremely dissapointed.  I am astounded that anyone would even sell this product!

Avoid at all costs.  I think the other reviewers have said it very well.  It would be more comfortable to toss and turn on a bed of rusty nails.  I was totally hoodwinked by the price.  Save yourself the time and money.

First time I have used it, put it in a couple of days ago, so far so good. Seems safe for all the pond life and looks like a good sunshade.

It is now the 21st of June and the 2 gallons of shade is all gone. I had to put a different brand of shade in. Crystal Blue is not worth the price.

I used this cart for the first time yesterday, and the axle broke in half almost immediately. I didn't get 1 city block before it collapsed on me, leaving me with two bags of groceries to carry for an additional 2 blocks. It was only 15 pounds of groceries, so, I cannot imagine what this particular cart would be good for other than carrying air from one place to another. Not recommended at all.

Unlike other products in the same category, this one is sturdy and the splines will not break.  But, they are very flexible and the space between the splines is quite wide.  Moreover there is no backstop to prevent the loaf from moving while you're slicing.  Bottom line: if you're looking for mechanical assistance to create slices of uniform thickness, this isn't it.  A better idea: buy an electric knife & learn to use it.

This slicer is one of the worst we have used. We make bread at home every couple days and use slicers frequently. This slicer need to be used very carefully, if you are using a sharp bread knife it is very easy to get slivers of plastic in your bread without even noticing until you pull the loaf out.
summary: This slicer is one of the worst we have used

reviewText:
It was broken in quite a few pieces when received. I have not idea how to get it exchanged. That information was not in the box when I received it.
I believe the way it was packed may have had something to do with it being broken.

I really loved this ring holder as it is beautiful. However, like the other 1 star reviews, the ring holder split in half all on its own. Nothing was touching it nor was it near a heat source. All of a sudden I heard glass breaking and when I looked over at my table, I noticed that the ring holder was completely broken in two.
summary: I really loved this ring holder as it is beautiful

reviewText: Arrived broken. One of the lid screws broke out of the chipped wood.  As a result, the lid doesn't close properly. Disappointed with quality.  I was able to unscrew the other one as well. Not worth my trouble to return. If I can manage to take out both screws, Im going to see if I can just put hinges on it.

I searched and searched for a tea storage box that would fit on my 11 3/4" shelf , but this doesn't fit and the dimensions listed on the box are 12 3/8" x 7 1/4" x 3 1/2" high (31,5cm x 18,5cm x 9cm). Without a latch to keep it closed either, it's worthless to me.

Please research before buying.  Praying mantids can be very invasive and they will eat anything, even beneficial species like bees and ladybugs. They take over niches occupied by other species.  It's a bad idea to introduce them to your garden.
summary: even beneficial species like bees and ladybugs

reviewText: I order flowers once a year, for valentines day. I had my order canceled a week prior to valentines day. Are you kidding me? If you need flowers for any occasion, this is not the place to get them. Buyer beware.

As an organic gardener I really wanted these mantis eggs (as well as the lady bugs I bought from this same supplier) to work. It's now been over a month since I followed the package directions and I still don't have any activity. There appears to be no change with the egg sacks at all. There is no return on this product, so I definitely feel like I wasted my money. I hate to give a one-star rating, but I feel like at least one of the egg sacks should have yielded some mantises.

Since it is stated these are Chinese mantis eggs, is it really a good idea to import them into the US?  Mantids are so voracious they can really hurt the population of native praying mantis species, much like Japanese ladybugs have destroyed native ladybug species.  Insect control is better for the environment and more interesting than pesticides, but native mantis species should be used instead.  Keep the native species alive!
summary: Is it really a good idea to bring in non-native insects?

reviewText: I purchased the praying mantis egg cases for my daughter.  We put them into our mantis habitat and patiently waited for the babies to "hatch".  Apparently I was sent duds because the babies never came.  What a disappointment for my daughter.  When I contacted the seller, the customer service was horrible and they would not acknowledge my problem.  Do not order from this seller!!!!!!  There are many other places to order praying mantis egg cases.

Very disappointed with the quality and size of the glasses.  They are smaller than I thought they were. I thought they were the size of a wine glass. They are actually about the size of a large shot glass . The picture showing the size, like put a wine glass next to them.
summary: Very disappointed with the quality and size of the glasses

reviewText: I bought one of these about two years ago for my computer room. Today the nylon cords on the right side of the chair broke making the chair useless now. I only weigh 190lbs and these things are supposed to be able to support a person who weighs 300lbs! Go and check out the chairs made by Camco. They are roomier and only cost about half as much as the Faulkner.

We ordered this product which came quickly but was damaged.  A replacement was sent and it was also damaged plus some parts were missing.  We didn't think it would do any good to send it back so we requested replacement parts from the manufacturer.  It will take 4 to 6 weeks for them to get here.  If we ever get to use it, it might be a nice piece.  We'll see.
summary: Don't bother to order this product unless you want substantial grief.

reviewText: I just received this clock as a present, and it is a piece of garbage.  It LOOKS nice, but the quality of the clock is poor.  It's just glued-together wood.  The clock itself is crap: the face is made out of paper, the hands are made of cheap plastic, and they used a pin to hold the hands to the knobs for setting the time.  It stopped working almost immediately, for no reason.

When I first started using this, I loved it. It has a large handle and it was easy to use. Then after a few months it started slipping and now it won't even clamp down on the lip of the can or if it does it only goes 1/2 inch or so before coming off. Total waste of money. I am back to using my electric can opener. Look for another brand, save your money.

Aweful!!  Too small for men's shoes (size 9.5), even sneakers.  Only women's shoes might fit in these.  If you need to store men's shoes, do yourself a favor and buy the bigger ones from Container Store.  Disappointed.
summary: Aweful!!  Too small for men's shoes!

reviewText: I thought the pebble kitchen sink protector was something different and cute. The smell of the sink protector is awful. I thought the smell would lessen over time. We have tried everything to eliminate  the smell. You can smell the protectors as you walk into the kitchen
summary: I thought the pebble kitchen sink protector was something different ...

reviewText: I have gone through two suction sponge holders in the last 15+ years. This is the third one --and only one-- that has not stuck to my normal stainless steel sink. I mean, does not stick no matter what I do. What a waste of money.

This looked like a cute idea but when it gets all greasy and stained it's not so cute anymore. I like that it prevents dishes from cracking and that you can wash it in the dishwasher but once it goes back in the sink it gets all dirty and I didn't like that grimy feeling at the bottom of the sink. It turned out to be one more thing to have to clean. Save your money.

My review keeps getting censored from Amazon for some reason so I doubt you'll see this but maybe the people at amazon who feel it should be censored could show a little professionalism by telling me what is wrong with my review - I await....
summary: My review keeps getting censored from Amazon for some reason ...

reviewText: I purchased this tent to use at arts and crafts festivals.  The first time I set it up two hours into the festival a gust of wind came along and bent the aluminum frame so badly we had to pack up and go home and the tent was ruined after  one use.  No other tents in the festival were damaged,  the stakes to hold it in the ground were so flimsy that we could bend them with our hands.

I bought one of these from Walmart. I have it turned on. No heat coming out. Either it is defective, or (?). I guess it is not working. I will have to take it back. I expected more from Honeywell for the money I paid.

I really wanted this bag to work but it just doesn't. I wanted it to bring back groceries from the store but it is very awkward to pull and almost as painful on the arms as carrying bags. It clearly isn't meant for heavy groceries but I can't imagine what it would be useful for as one could simply carry light bags.

The heating element of this kettle is covered with plastic.  When the water is heated it tastes like plastic.  It is one of only a few items I have ever bought that I returned. It does look cool when it boils, but it is not worth it.  Save your time and money and buy a stainless steel water kettle.

This kettle does have a chemical smell and imparts a chemical taste to the water.  I suspect all these kettles have a checmical smell, just that some are more sensitive to it than others.  I would consider myself sensitive.  I ran multiple cleaning batches of water through the kettle.  There was a slight decrease in the chemical smell, but not enough.  If I can smell and taste chemical I have no interest in using it to boil water.  I do not recommend this product because of the materials used.

This is a very nice looking electric kettle, and it worked fine, but broke in less than 6 months.  We returned it for a new one, however the second one lasted less than 3 months!  We've gone back to an old-school kettle...
summary: Make sure you save your receipt!

reviewText: I've had this coffee maker for 10 months and keep waiting for the coffee to taste better...today I gave up!  It brews quickly and is easy to use, but the flavor is lousy!  I've tried freshly ground beans, and numerous other types of coffee and still the coffee tastes awful.  Today I will buy a new coffeemaker and donate this one.  Don't bother buying this!

A coffee maker you can't turn back on to warm up the coffee? Yes, you can set the timer to keep the coffee warm longer, but that's an unnecessary hassle. Setting the clock and timer is definitely NOT an intuitive process, unlike it was with our previous Krups model. This is not an inexpensive coffee maker, but it sure acts like one. I expected more out of this company, but no more.

This hanger is terrible and should be taken off the market.  When you place your platter in the hanger and try to hang it up the springs stretch out and the platter falls to the floor.  My platter was 23 1/2" so it should have worked.  I requested a refund for my purchase and promptly received it.
summary: This hanger is terrible and should be taken off the market

reviewText: This might work for young children, but for adults, the AstroTurf for the bottom of my shoes is below the level of the surrounding plastic. The sides work well for the shoe edge, but the bottom is only good for the heel and toe. I don't recommend this product.
summary: OK for people with tiny shoes

reviewText: After about a year of use, the seat has gone flat. It's like sitting on a board. For the kind of money it costs, I'm sure the seat cushion could easily be upgraded. Extremely disappointed in the quality!

I've been sitting on this chair for a year now and my back has never felt worse. I bought a Mckensie D lumbar roll to compensate for the lack of back support, but with the way this chair is designed, no back support will EVER stay comfortably in place as the lower part of the back is not as wide as the top and slants down at an angle. I am 5' 11'' and overweight and the butt "cushion" portion of this sad excuse for a chair is not long enough which results in my legs going numb.

The two I purchased seemed very healthy when I got them, but one is growing well, but the other one seems to be dying and I can not figure out why. They are in good soil and I did not receive any directions for planting them when they arrived.
summary: They are in good soil and I did not receive any directions for ...

reviewText: FIRST THE PACKAGE NEVER ARRIVED, THEN AFTER CONTACTING AMAZON THEY SEND IT BUT  THERE WHERE MAYBE  100 WORMS IN THERE. VERY SMALL AND WEEK ONES THAT DIED RIGHT AFTER I PUT THEM INTO MY CAREFULLY PREPARED WORM COMPOSTER.

I bought this a year ago.  I never opened it and the box was put into a cabinet in my laundry room until today.  I took it out of the cabinet and began to use it according to the instructions.  After a lot of scrubbing with the sponge and very little tarnish being removed, I decided it was more trouble than it was worth and threw it away.  I've always used Wright's silver polish and will be going back to it.
summary: I bought this a year ago. I never opened ...

reviewText:
When I called the company to get some verification that they were actually HEPA filters I was told that they were "better than HEPA filters supplied by Whirlpool...".  When I asked for verification in writing I was told they do not share that information....

This is clearly a product not supported by the claims of the original HEPA product by Whirlpool.

 The time it took to settle the issue was excessive and then the $76.00 that it took to send them back was not reimbursed.
summary: Company will not guarantee that is an actual HEPA filter

reviewText: The on/off switch was loose on the unit. It's very cheaply made so I'm not surprised. Because of the looseness of the switch, the unit does not connect properly and the electrodes do not function like it should. Returning it for a refund.
summary: You get what you pay for.

reviewText: These are lousy. Don't buy them. They wrinkle up and/or fall off after a couple days. I saw a restaurant have the same ones and they were wrinkling up and falling off too! I've done everything I can to get these to work, but they are so worthless, they will probably go to the trash.

This lavender is a rip-off, and if I hadn't opened it, I would have sent it back. It comes in a cellophane bag and has a slight scent when you first open it, but that quickly dissipates. I bought it for drawer sachets and it's useless.

It was the biggest waste of money!!! We used it for the first time and it immediately broke. Not to mention it took like three months to actually get delivered! DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!! It will be a huge mistake.

I tried putting as many bags on this device as I would normally carry in without it and it broke on the first try. From my car to my front door is about 15 yards and it broke just as I reached my front door. It would work well with about max 35lbs (5 bags). But, if you are like me and enjoy as few of trips as possible, this device doesn't work so well. It has a nice grip and feel to it.

I was hoping this would be as ready to rock as I am when I get home from grocery shopping. The package says it has a maximum load of 50 lbs, but the latch is pulled away from the locking mechanism (rendering the product useless) at a much lower weight than that. The breaking point might be 50 lbs, but after about 25 lbs, it isn't helpful.

UNFORTUNATELY, I CANNOT GIVE THIS PRODUCT A ZERO AND IT'S TOO BAD BECAUSE THAT'S BEING GENEROUS!! THIS PRODUCT DOES NOTHING THAT IT CLAIMS. WHEN THEY ARE PUT IN THE GARBAGE DISPOSAL, YOU MIGHT PICK UP THE SUBTLE SCENT OF LEMON OR ORANGE AND THEN AS QUICK AS THEY WENT IN, THE SCENT IS GONE. THEY DON'T DO A GREAT JOB OF BREAKING UP FOOD OR FAT IN THE DISPOSAL. MY SUGGESTION IS THAT YOU'D PROBABLY BE BETTER OFF USING REAL LEMON OR ORANGE PEELS IN YOUR DISPOSAL.

Simply put, this fan is loud.  At its lowest speed, it is pretty darn fast, and a fast fan tends to be a loud fan.  There is no way to run this fan in a slower, quieter mode.  Too bad, as the fan is great looking and pretty solidly built.

This is my second fan. They both had the same problem. Whatever holds the "head" up is not strong enough. Both head-holding-up mechanisms failed. After this happened the first time, Soleus replaced the fan but the shipping was so high I may as well have bought another from Amazon. Anyway, the head fell off (the black plastic simply shattered) on the second fan as well. I won't be buying any more Soleus fans!
summary: After 8 months of use, head falls off (this has happened twice, two new fans)

reviewText: This thing is a rip-off. The hot glue used to stick the puller to the car won't stick to anything. It won't stick to the car and it won't stick to the puller.  It just doesn't work. I want my money back!

After following the instructions exactly, the product doesn't work when trying to remove any dings.  The pull tabs ripped away from the glue before the glue came off the truck, leaving big chunks of the adhesive on the vehicle.  Then the next time I tried it, the pull tabs completely broke in half before pulling the adhesive off. Cheap, worthless product, wish I could get a refund.
summary: DO NOT BUY product is worthless

reviewText: It did not work at all. I ended up with a refrigerator/freezer that just plain stunk. Ruined a gallon of milk and some leftovers.  Was very disappointed, I have had one before and it was wonderful, guess this one was defective.

Read VERY carefully. Seems to be misleading to me. They got me with this one. I just looked at the picture and didn't take the time to really read anything. This is not a funnel, just a flexible tube. My fault for not considering that a crappy piece of flexible tube would cost $10 without a funnel. I will pay shipping to return.
summary: Misleading picture. Make sure you know what you're buying.

reviewText:
They look really cool if you want an alternative to an infuser.

But they all fell apart after 4 or 5 uses.

So, if you want an alternative to something that will actually last more than a handful of times, look elsewhere.
summary: The Perfect Alternative To Something That Will Last

reviewText: I didn't pay close enough attention to the specs of this product--it's too short for what I need. That's my fault, but the low rating is because the top is so flimsy! It doesn't stay on tight--falls off half the time I push some trash into it.
summary: Top doesn't stay on snug. Cheap quality.

reviewText: Arrived dusty, filthy, scratched.  The trash can is also small with a small opening, which is definitely not what I wanted.  I was trying to get a trash can bigger and with a more user-friendly top than the one I have.  This isn't it.

We bought this because it looked convenient and easy.  Before we even put it in the microwave it was too runny.  We put it in the microwave thinking that maybe that would thicken it up a bit but it was just worse.  It just left a runny mess on our cupcakes.  We tried two colors and they were both awful.  Save frustration and make your own icing.
summary: This stuff is like colored water

reviewText: We bought a house with 4 pecan trees and the previous owners left one of these. When we found the number of pecans we had were too much for one person, we searched and found this one. It looks just like it. However, it definitely is not made by the same maker and is made with a different material. When it arrived, the spacing between the wires was too large. It would not pickup any pecans. We had to modify it, tie the wires closer together. We had too many pecans to pickup to send it back.
summary: It looks just like it. However

reviewText: this product didn't come to me with the springs as shown in the picture.  All the coils were pushed off to one side and when I tried to space them out, it didn't work.  I should have returned it.  I think if it would have came to me as shown in the picture, it would have worked just fine.
summary: Coils are pushed off to one side, not delivered as shown in picture

reviewText: Incredibly sticky, you're always having to peel them apart. One came melted together on the inside and was unusable. They're also very bulky, and I couldn't imagine putting more than two on a keychain.

They were cute at first and did exactly what they were suppose to do. And then they all started to tear and fall apart. I guess they weren't made to withstand being inside pockets for that long which is kind of where I think most people keep their keys. If you do buy these, just be aware that the rubber is very soft and if you put these on consecutive keys they stick to each other and pull on each other.
summary: They were cute at first and did exactly what they ...

reviewText: Yes, technically, it does work. But it's extremely difficult to get it to even fit on your ear (look at the design of the damn thing) and then it has to be in the EXACTLY right position for it to chirp when your head moves forward and down. (Remember, it does not work for side-to-side motion.) I worked with it for about an hour and then threw it in the trash. Not worth even trying to send it back to Amazon. Save your money!

I guess as cheap as it is, just keep buying it every 2 months. Broke down in less than 2 months. I even changed the battery--which it doesnt even tell you what size it is and there are so many in that size that you have to make a guess when you go to the store.

I never used this item and this is why, I read the warning on the bottle and it said it may cause irreversible damage to skin or eyes. You must wear gloves! If it can cause this much damage to your eyes or skin, what can it do to your lungs if you breathe it thru the humidifier? Not taking a chance, going back!!

Reading the label and warnings about this product has scared us enough to not use it. You cannot let it touch your skin, do not inhale it, ect. What is its purpose if it is going to make us sick by adding it to our humidifier water if it's dangerous to inhale?

I know that the description does mention that this is a 32 oz bottle, but the photo gives a vastly misleading impression that you will be receiving a large jug of this stuff. Not the case. You will be receiving a small, upright bottle, not this big bottle with a handle. My mistake for not considering how large or small 32 oz. is compared to the photo which is probably a 64 or 96 oz bottle.

I had no idea until I received the product in a leaking box that it is dangerous and corrosive. If it comes into contact with skin it can do permanent damage so be careful. I was not impressed that the company sent the product in inappropriate packaging for such a toxic product. I sent it back for a refund. A few drops of bleach will work just as good.

In the picture it looks like it's a decent, regular sized piggy bank. It's actually incredibly small. It can fit in my hand perfectly. It's something I would have been happy to pay 5 bucks for, Not $17(that's including my shipping). If I would have known it was going to be this small, I would have not wasted my money. Not worth it in my opinion.
summary: A LOT SMALLER THAN IT LOOKS

reviewText: It cost me $22 for not reading the product description correctly. THIS ITEM IS FOR THE SIDE RAILS ONLY! You are not buying a cart. I didn't open the box but whatever is in there seems pretty substantial.

It says iRobot Advanced Power System and the webpage gives the impression this is an authentic iRobot battery.  The iRobot battery actually has Advanced Power System on the label.  The most this thing will run is an hour and then it dies.

The ad specs say this is made by iRobot but the one I received is made by Tenergy.

The ad specs say this is for a Roomba 500 series.  The one I received is for an Roomba 400 series.

I am trying to return this for a refund.  I will not buy from this vendor again (Battery SuperStore).
summary: Received wrong battery and not made by iRobot

reviewText: The battery UltraSonic sent was clearly not an iRobot battery.  It worked for a day and then refused to charge, even after troubleshooting.  This is a perfect example of "you get what you pay for" - I'll be returning this and shelling out the full amount for a REAL iRobot battery.

I had been looking at this iron for months and finally purchased it after a string of positive review. The sole plate is not smooth or polished, so it does not glide across your fabric. I was looking for a good quilting iron, but with this sole plate the iron would not work for quilting or ironing clothes. Fortunately it also arrived dented, so I was able to return it to Amazon without any problem.
summary: Believe the bad reviews, I didn't...

reviewText: I suspect the positive reviews on this iron are from people who have only used it a short time. I've kept ours working for several years, but only with the help of a soldering iron, some glue, and a spare power cord. Unless you like buying an iron every year, I'd recommend you buy something else.

The back won't peel off without ripping apart the cork sheet.  And if you can actually get the back to peel off without destroying the cork, it still isn't sticky enough to be useful whatsoever.  I hope I can get a refund.  I rarely leave negative reviews on any product I buy, but this was just the biggest waste of money.

This bag we gave up on, in favor of the Norpro.  It has pleats in the bottom, that allow all the liquid to move out in a puddle.  Those pleats don't serve the intended purpose.  We switched bags and threw this one out.

This think stank so badly I had to get  it cleaned, which only abated the odor a tiny bit, so I soaked it in cold water with Woolite, which helped a little more but not enough.  Then I washed it in cold water with a mild detergent, and the thing fell apart.
summary: This think stank so badly I had to get it ...

reviewText: This cage is too small for stray cats!  The label on the cage says that it is for rabbits, squirrels, and skunks.  This would be an extremely inhumane trap for a stray cat because it is much too small.. I think they need to do their research on stray cats before labeling products such as this.
summary: Do not buy this for a cat!

reviewText: What a piece of junk this is. It's flimsy. It won't stay locked open. It rusted after one use. The metal bends easily. Most importantly, there is no release door. You have to hold the trap door open for the animal to exit. I wish I had bought any other trap other than this trap. Literally any other trap.
summary: Save your money for a better trap.

reviewText: Bought the unit for myself.......... Used one time and went to use it a second time and the kettle would not heat...... I found it really a let down....... have been trying to find corn poppers that is convenient  and was hoping this would be the one ........  Very upsetting to get this ......... would not recommend this to anyone ........ it as if they do not care for their products.......

I have been with Amazon for a long time and I must thank you for the honest reviews.  I found this corn popper in a catalog from another company and thought it would be a great Christmas gift for my wife.  I took a chance that maybe Amazon would have the same popper.  I looked it up and wonder of wonders, you have it....along with some scathing reviews. I thank you for coming to the rescue.  You saved me $150.00 and kept my 50 year marriage intact  God Bless.....

The picture depicts adult size wigs. The back of the package clearly states that the wigs are for adult use only, not intended for children. Let me tell you something: these wigs do not fit adult heads. These wigs do not fit children heads. I don't think one of these wigs would fit the head of a newborn. Waste of money.

The Purse Organizer is reasonably priced.  For me, however, everything about it is too small, compartments too tight and it flops open too far and things can/do fall out. I don't carry much in my average size handbags so didn't want a Purse Organizer too large yet I tend to think this item is better suited for a young teenager.  I used it once.

Unfortunately it didn't catch any mice. I bought three different kinds of humane mousetraps, including this one, and none of them worked. The only kind that worked for me were the old school kill mousetraps. It's a great idea, though.

The trap is too small. To set up the latch is difficult as it is not easily set. Once the lach is set, putting the trap in place sets off the trap. After many tries my husband finally sets the trap.
So far, we have not caught our "Visitor" as he manages to get the treat w/o springing the latch. So far, it's been over a week and still no luck.

Put some food in the trap to attract our little house guest. Next morning, food was gone, but the trap hadn't activated. Thought it might be a fluke, so I tried it again. Same result. Don't waste your money.

I don't know if this is a piece of crap, or if my home is infested with like the world's smartest mice, but this thing has been locked and loaded for a month and NADA. Still seeing mice, on occasion, but they have no interest in this item no matter what I fill it with.
summary: It's not you, it's my mice

reviewText:
It seems like mice have gone in and out of the trap but the trap mechanism just won't trigger. I've had it for maybe two weeks now and it seems that mice have been going in and out and nibbling the bits of cupcake I put inside, as evidenced by increasing amounts of mouse feces on the inside of the trap. And believe me, I think I've set the trap right. It's also much smaller than what the picture leads you to believe. Pictures to follow.

Avoid!
summary: The trap mechanism won't trigger. Pictures to follow. Avoid!

reviewText:
Can you give me one valid reason why green and not fully transparent?
Why no clear indication (like LED or a reflective tape) to indicate from a distance that the trap is closed?

By the time I saw that there was a mouse in the trap, the mouse was already dead - because I saw neither that the trap door was closed, nor that there was a mouse inside the trap - due to the two reasons mentioned in the questions above.

I thought I would wait a while until I tried to use it before writing a review. This thing has been completely useless. I followed all the instructions carefully, put all the food in there, placed it in almost every part of the house and the mouse totally ignores it. He still lives here today and it has been over a month now.
summary: Sorry, but this has been useless

reviewText: I set this trap in the same location with same bait as Havahart trap on three separate occasions. Each time, I caught a mouse in the Havahart mouse trap & released it 5 miles away. This trap did absolutely nothing. Spend the extra $4 and get  a Havahart mouse trap.

I guess you could say it works at catching mice but what's the point of being able to catch them if it won't hold them. The mouse got out after being caught. He left his poop and he ate the peanut butter and then he figured out an exit, which has to have been the door that snaps shut. I guess if you have a stupid mouse, this trap will work, but if you have one of those smart mice, like I do, it won't work.
summary: Caught the mouse but not for long

reviewText: I purchased this because I have a small mouse OR vole eating my vegetables.  I placed a cracker with peanut butter on it inside the trap.  Well, the mouse outsmarted the trap because the cracker was gone.  I placed a second cracker inside the trap and again the mouse took the cracker without getting caught.  This trap did not work for me.

This mouse trap is too small. I had food in the very back, small pieces of food, and the mice were able to take the food out without triggering the device. I haven't caught a single one with this. Disappointed, because it seems it would work well if it was larger.

This trap needs more vents!!  I checked the trap several times while I was home, and no mouse.  Then a mouse was trapped while I was at work, and when I came home, the mouse was dead.  I felt absolutely terrible.  The whole point of me purchasing this "humane" trap was to avoid hurting an animal!!  There was a lot on condensation on the inside of the trap, and I assume the poor thing suffocated.  If you buy this trap, make sure you drill more ventilation holes.

I am very disappointed with this trap. My mouse got in, ate the cracker and got back out without setting off the trap and then never went in it again. After resetting the trap three times, the thing that holds the door open wouldn't hold it open anymore so it was a complete waste of money. I'm now on day 12 of having a mouse in my house and on my second live trap from somewhere else. I think the cracker I gave him was so much food that he's stored it and isn't hungry yet.

Three nights in a row we've set the trap and the mouse has run in, grabbed the cracker with peanut butter and ran back out. Not sure why the trap isn't closing on the mouse, we're sure its a mouse since we've had a few sitings already.
summary: Our mouse is getting well fed from this trap

reviewText:
I'm sorry but this doesn't work at all. I watched mice walk in and out of the trap. It's funny it's shaped like a home, because that's what it is for mice.

If they're in your house, too bad for them. I wussed out. Now there's bait and spring traps everywhere.
summary: A humane mouse trap for: a (Money) trap for humans, not Mice

reviewText: It didn't work! I have no idea what I'm doing wrong. I tried peanut butter, cheese, crackers, trail mix, all different things (not all at once) and nothing worked. Plus, the hinge weakens and the trap gets ultra sensitive the more you set it... no good. I didn't want to have to kill this mouse but this thing doesn't work!!

As others have noted, the mouse can chew through the door hinges.  I checked in the morning after setting the trap the night before, and bingo, the WHOLE DOOR was gone.  Took me a while to find it.  Apparently, the mouse got trapped, ate through the cheap plastic hinge of the door, and was gone.  STUPID DESIGN!  STUPID PRODUCT!

Don't bother getting this thing out. It is not worth the time and effort to get out and wash because if your apple isn't the perfect size and shape it will skip all over the apple and only peel small sections here and there. Forget about it!
summary: What a waste of my time and money

reviewText: Should the batteries happen to die midway through opening a can...you're out of luck.  The opener will not disengage from the can (you REALLY can't yank it off of there!), and the batteries cannot be replaced while it's still clamped down on the can.  I don't know what knucklehead came up with that design idea, but I think he or she needs to find another line of work.

I have had this can opener for 3 weeks and I cut my finger today. The can opener opens cans by chopping off the entire lid. That leaves a razor sharp edge on the top of the can. I put a spoon in the can to remove food and cut my finger on the sharp edge. Hands-free isn't better than a conventional can opener when it causes injury.
summary: This is dangerous! Do not buy this!

reviewText: I purchased one of these and it died. I thought it was something I did wrong so I purchased another one. The second one came to me half dead and much smaller than the first one.  It died completely 3 days later. Poor quality product, do not buy this item.

I was given this as a gift, it is NOT worth the money. It's loud, doesn't drive straight, hard to push, does a TERRIBLE job, and I've already had it serviced to try and fix some of the problems. I can go around and pick up lint and dirt by scraping my hand over the carpet after I've vacuumed - and do a better job (and I'm not making that up!!)I'm finally going to replace it with something that works and hope that the gift-giver doesn't notice ;)

I purchased the Oreck five years ago and wish I had not.  I suppose that it can suck up a bowling ball.  I have a dog and a cat, and the vacuum clogs rapidly.  It is not easy to unclog.  I have brought the vacuum in for unclogging several times.  I am now looking for another vacuum and will be disposing of the Oreck XL very shortly.  For the amount that a new Oreck sells for, it is vastly over priced.  For its quality of performance, the price should not be more than $100.

This Mix 'n Chop is a must have and sells for $11.50 in the Pampered Chef catalog. You are being ripped off if you buy Pampered Chef product from this seller. Go to [...] and search your zip code for a consultant in your area. He/She will gladly help you with your purchase and can even save you money on shipping. Remember, the only way you get The Pampered Chef warranty is by buying your products directly from the company.
summary: Don't get ripped off by buying Pampered Chef products here

reviewText:
We have a masonry heater with two large glass windows.  This is a high temperature wood burning heater.  The only way I have found to reliably remove soot/creosote from the glass is with a razor blade.  Based on the high ratings of this product I had high hopes.

Unfortunately it did not even make a dent in the soot/creosote on the glass.  I followed the instructions as provided. I was able to get a small amount off but only with a ton of elbow grease.
summary: Worth a try but did not touch high temperature soot on glass.

reviewText: Bought one and it arrived and did not work.  Bought another one and it arrived in the same condition.  Called American Weigh and they offered to send me one that works if I sent them the defective one.  This somehow did not seem like a good deal.  The seller was not helpful either.  Amazon of course is the best and they are picking it up and refunding the cost.

This scale is not accurate over 200 grams.  At first the scale seems to track linearly and then when a second and equal amount is added, the weight does not double.  In fact, at some points, as I am adding weight, the readout starts dropping.  So obviously there is a problem with this unit but one would never know without using calibrated weights.  And the scale is only a couple of years old.  I'll be looking for a different scale this time.

I chose this reason because I ordered this, and didn't get it; ordered it again; didn't get it. Ordered it again, they just gave my money back. I don't know what the problem was, but I'd still  like to try it, it just doesn't seem to be possible.

I am very disappointed!  I first used it 3 days ago.  I have moved the sprinklers 6-8 times and one of the hoses broke OFF.  The end was screwed into the sprinkler and when I lifted it  the hose was laying on the ground. It was completely sheared off.  I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND PURCHASING.
summary: I am very disappointed! I first used it 3 days ago

reviewText: We have hard ground - it's almost impossible to get the rather large plastic spikes on the sprinklers into the ground far enough to hold the sprinklers in place. The construction seems flimsy - one of the connectors on the set we ordered was broken when we opened the box. Also, the hoses that come with these are 1/2 diameter and rather flimsy, which means water flow (especially for the second and third sprinklers) tends to be low. There are much better solutions our there.

I ordered two sets of this system.  It was a waste of money.  The hoses broke off from the connections on 3 out of the 6 sprinklers I ordered.  I glued them on with Gorilla Glue, being careful not to block the water flow.  However, the water never reached the third sprinkler even with the faucet on full force.  The sprinklers that got water just gurgled and never got to a full spray.  It's just not worth sending them back.  I'll eat the cost and throw them away.
summary: It was a waste of money

reviewText: This Item does not deserve a star at all but zero star is not an option.  We purchased a set similar to this one last year and wanted to add to it (the old set still works fine)  however, this set  is poorly made.  While trying to connect them, all three of the hose connectors broke from the sprinkler heads with the slightest pull on the hose.  I don't know who made them but they are of very poor quality.

I don't know the name of the part that I want to discuss.  It is the part that screws into the faucet or hose.  Whatever it is called, all three on the sprinkler system I received broke at the neck as soon as I put the sprinkler on the ground.  The hose was at a slight angle to the what-do-you-call-it and it just snapped.  I don't think I am strong enough to have broken it by handling it. I have never had this happen before no matter how cheap the hose or sprinkler was.
summary: with 3 in 1 you get what you pay for, or maybe less

reviewText: We bought this triple spray sprinkler system to extend a similar system we already had.  It is made of light weight plastic and one of the sprayers broke in the process of putting it into the ground.  Every part of the system is very delicate and prone to breakage.  Because they will be used in a lawn, they will have to be removed every time in order to mow--and the other sprayers and the attachments to the hose will no doubt break too.  VERY POOR QUALITY!

It would almost be okay if our colors were maroon, white and blue. The color is horrible and I mean horrible.  The blue has white speckles in it (on one of my flags) and the grommets are different sizes. I could live with the last two issues if the colors were correct. Did I mention that the color is horrible? You should not waste your money on this product. I wish I hadn't.

I bought this because we needed a bag to store our tree and put it in storage. We put our tree in, which was 7 ft tall, and as soon as my husband went to pick it up, the bag ripped and he was left with the handles in his hand and the tree and bag on the floor.

In short, this burner is rubbish for the simple fact that the buttons respond only occasionally when pressed so you are never quite sure if it is going to work.  I  regret not having read the Cook's Illustrated reviews prior to purchasing it because now I am stuck with a product I find unusable.  A complete waste of money. I imagine the other reviews are by people who are getting subsidized to write nice things.
summary: Are these people getting paid to write these reviews?

reviewText: I purchased this a while back. I have tried using it on several occasions to do iron on transfers. Following instructions on the iron and on the iron on transfers, I was disappointed to find that it did not work. This product is a waste of money. Do not buy!

One of the bolts that supports the back of the chair came out. (It's inside the fabric and you can not get to it to fix it without cutting it) The chair was in storage for a period of time and the warranty time ran out before noticing the defect. So it lasted less than six months and now it's useless.
summary: So it lasted less than six months and now it's useless.

reviewText: The 'bonded leather' has started to wear off. It has been a few years, but still I have not mistreated the chair and you would expect it to last longer. Fairly disappointed. Buy real leather if you can afford it because it will last you longer and look better.
summary: Fairly disappointed. Buy real leather if you can afford it ...

reviewText: I bought this chair back in January.  It sits pretty low to the ground so I have to raise it up all the way.  About a month ago, the shock started giving out and now it will not stay raised at all.  I didn't really expect this to last very long but I thought I would at least get a year or two out of it.

Comfortable - for a while. This chair is unfortunately very poor quality. The "leather" arms and seat and back starts to peel after a while, and the mechanism that holds it to the feet becomes loose and it wobbles real bad. After a while it started to tilt to one side. I didn't get two years of intermittent use out of this chair before it went into the garbage where it belongs.
summary: Comfortable but very poor quality. Not durable at all, wears out very fast.

reviewText: After only a few short months, of hardly being used, the chair sinks to the floor every time you sit in it.  Use the lever to raise the chair back up, sit down, and it sinks back to the floor again within a couple mins.. Although fun, it is irritating when you can no longer see over your desk...
summary: Although fun, it is irritating when you can no longer ...

reviewText: This is the second of these chairs I have purchased. The first one was great until the "leather plus" began to peel off after about five years. The new chairs seat is pillowed up in the center center making it uncomfortable to sit in. I've had some medical issues to deal with and didn't get around to testing this chair until now. According to Amazon it's too late to return it so I guess I'm stuck. I'm begining to wonder if shopping locally might be a better option for a chair like this.

This chair is very uncomfortable.  It took me forever to find something that would even make it bearable to sit in all day and finally I found something that cost me $50.  I have no idea why the seat is so hard, but it is and it makes my tailbone hurt so much I can hardly last all day in it.  Do yourself a favor and buy another chair - not this one!

left hand arm on chair broke.  It cracked in half where one of the screws attach it to the chair.  I haven't even had this chair for a month yet.  I am very unhappy with the fact that this chair broke in less than a month and it appears that I can't return it.  I would like a replacement arm for my chair..  The arm in question is the left hand side if you are sitting in the chair.  I like the chair but just need a replacement arm.
summary: arm broke after less than a month

reviewText: The leather has peeled off all over the place and the house is full of little pieces of this crap.  Really hate it.  Anyone have a chair that is still being sold and you've had it and been happy with it at least five years?  If so, please let us know--my son has multiple back fractures and really needs a good chair.  THIS SITS WELL, but I wish I was kidding about all of the leather peeling off--it is a horrible MESS!
summary: Leather peels off leaving a MESS

reviewText: The lowest height of this chair is too high.  My feet barely touch the floor and I'm 5'11.  The moment I lean back, I'm on my tippy toes.  The comfort of this chair is poor.  The seat is shallow and ends mid thigh.  The quality is also poor, and my chair has started to fall apart and wobble during the first month.

I bought this chair and twenty others of a different brand.  I bought them all at the same time 90 days ago.  This one broke.  The other brand chairs are all in perfect condition.  If you want a chair that lasts for less than 3 months, buy this one.

I bought this chair about 1.5 years ago from Costco and need to say this is a worst investment I have ever done. Started to squeak very loud 6 months after I bought it (I weigh 130lb). No way to put oil inside, no way to fix squeaking.

Way too big and what is the most important I developed neck problems while using this chair. My neck is getting better since I threw that **** away. I wasn't even feeling like selling or giving it to anyone, just threw it away.

Don't waste your money, stay away.

I like this chair except for one major defect - IT SQUEAKS LIKE CRAZY! When I lean back in the chair, then set up straight, there's always these annoying squeaks. I'm even considering trashing the chair and getting a new one. BEWARE!!!

Like other reviewers mentioned, this chair squeaks a lot. I had it for 2 days, and it started squeaking. Now I'm required to lubricate the location where it makes the noises every two weeks. After a several months, lubrication no longer fixes the noise, it constantly squeaks whenever I moved a bit. I'm sensitive to these noises. I really hate this chair.

I asked my husband to get me a nice leather desk chair for Christmas. I didn't want to hurt his feelings so now I'm stuck with this and it's a total rip-off. Read more about bonded "leather" and you'll find out it can be only 10% leather! This chair cost him $200 and is cheap, black rubber. I absolutely hate it.
summary: CHEAP BONDED LEATHER is really expensive rubber!

reviewText: I used to have a metal gumdrop tree and loved it, this is not the same.  After my metal one broke last year and I have not been able to find a replacement, I bought this one to replace it for this year.  It is so lightweight I worry it will break all the time, and if you don't take the gumdrops off evenly around the tree it will fall over.  Maybe it works better for money?

I've had this kettle for months and keep hoping that I'll be able to get rid of the plastic flavor in the water it boils, but it's hopeless.  It ruins the flavor of tea, but is also probably harming anyone who drinks it.
summary: Strong smell and taste of plastic

reviewText: These things flop over in water. If you're not just using them as dry decorations, don't even bother. They will be face down in whatever wet surface you put them in. I put them in the punch for my son's birthday party. They were all face down in the punch. So yeah. A rubber ducky that can't stay up in water isn't much of a rubber ducky.

BUYER BEWARE!! Top of the pic has been cropped off, and the color is horribly washed-out -nearly grey and white rather than the stunning blue and yellow of the original painting. Don't be fooled by the pic shown on the page. I bought an Edward Hopper poster from the same seller and was very satisfied with it, but this doesn't even look like the painting.
summary: and the color is horribly washed-out -nearly grey and white rather than the stunning ...

reviewText: in the image they show, the top of the large tree isn't cropped off. in the actual product it is cropped off. the image quality is poor as well. if it weren't cropped and blown up i would have probably kept it.
summary: this wasn't what i expected, it was enlarged, had poor quality, and it was cropped

reviewText: The one I received leaks terribly.  It will not hold water any longer than a couple of minutes.  Also, the foam roller - sponge on the bottom seems so cheap that it would shred easily.  I do not in any way recommend spending $38 on this item.  Perhaps $20, and be prepared to use lots of sealant on it.  Plus, pray the foam roller on the bottom is tougher than it looks.

I thought it was battery operated.  Very disappointing, there is no cord at all.  There's a button for water output.  However, the only thing to retract water, is a small roller sponge.  You have to roll back and forth.  I did not actually try it out, but I don't think a small roller will extract much water at all.

It says iRobot Advanced Power System and the webpage gives the impression this is an authentic iRobot battery.  The iRobot battery actually has Advanced Power System on the label.  The most this thing will run is an hour and then it dies.

The ad specs say this is made by iRobot but the one I received is made by Tenergy.

The ad specs say this is for a Roomba 500 series.  The one I received is for an Roomba 400 series.

I am trying to return this for a refund.  I will not buy from this vendor again (Battery SuperStore).
summary: Received wrong battery and not made by iRobot

reviewText: The battery UltraSonic sent was clearly not an iRobot battery.  It worked for a day and then refused to charge, even after troubleshooting.  This is a perfect example of "you get what you pay for" - I'll be returning this and shelling out the full amount for a REAL iRobot battery.

I had been looking at this iron for months and finally purchased it after a string of positive review. The sole plate is not smooth or polished, so it does not glide across your fabric. I was looking for a good quilting iron, but with this sole plate the iron would not work for quilting or ironing clothes. Fortunately it also arrived dented, so I was able to return it to Amazon without any problem.
summary: Believe the bad reviews, I didn't...

reviewText: I suspect the positive reviews on this iron are from people who have only used it a short time. I've kept ours working for several years, but only with the help of a soldering iron, some glue, and a spare power cord. Unless you like buying an iron every year, I'd recommend you buy something else.

The back won't peel off without ripping apart the cork sheet.  And if you can actually get the back to peel off without destroying the cork, it still isn't sticky enough to be useful whatsoever.  I hope I can get a refund.  I rarely leave negative reviews on any product I buy, but this was just the biggest waste of money.

This bag we gave up on, in favor of the Norpro.  It has pleats in the bottom, that allow all the liquid to move out in a puddle.  Those pleats don't serve the intended purpose.  We switched bags and threw this one out.

This think stank so badly I had to get  it cleaned, which only abated the odor a tiny bit, so I soaked it in cold water with Woolite, which helped a little more but not enough.  Then I washed it in cold water with a mild detergent, and the thing fell apart.
summary: This think stank so badly I had to get it ...

reviewText: This cage is too small for stray cats!  The label on the cage says that it is for rabbits, squirrels, and skunks.  This would be an extremely inhumane trap for a stray cat because it is much too small.. I think they need to do their research on stray cats before labeling products such as this.
summary: Do not buy this for a cat!

reviewText: What a piece of junk this is. It's flimsy. It won't stay locked open. It rusted after one use. The metal bends easily. Most importantly, there is no release door. You have to hold the trap door open for the animal to exit. I wish I had bought any other trap other than this trap. Literally any other trap.
summary: Save your money for a better trap.

reviewText: Bought the unit for myself.......... Used one time and went to use it a second time and the kettle would not heat...... I found it really a let down....... have been trying to find corn poppers that is convenient  and was hoping this would be the one ........  Very upsetting to get this ......... would not recommend this to anyone ........ it as if they do not care for their products.......

I have been with Amazon for a long time and I must thank you for the honest reviews.  I found this corn popper in a catalog from another company and thought it would be a great Christmas gift for my wife.  I took a chance that maybe Amazon would have the same popper.  I looked it up and wonder of wonders, you have it....along with some scathing reviews. I thank you for coming to the rescue.  You saved me $150.00 and kept my 50 year marriage intact  God Bless.....

The picture depicts adult size wigs. The back of the package clearly states that the wigs are for adult use only, not intended for children. Let me tell you something: these wigs do not fit adult heads. These wigs do not fit children heads. I don't think one of these wigs would fit the head of a newborn. Waste of money.

The Purse Organizer is reasonably priced.  For me, however, everything about it is too small, compartments too tight and it flops open too far and things can/do fall out. I don't carry much in my average size handbags so didn't want a Purse Organizer too large yet I tend to think this item is better suited for a young teenager.  I used it once.

Unfortunately it didn't catch any mice. I bought three different kinds of humane mousetraps, including this one, and none of them worked. The only kind that worked for me were the old school kill mousetraps. It's a great idea, though.

The trap is too small. To set up the latch is difficult as it is not easily set. Once the lach is set, putting the trap in place sets off the trap. After many tries my husband finally sets the trap.
So far, we have not caught our "Visitor" as he manages to get the treat w/o springing the latch. So far, it's been over a week and still no luck.

Put some food in the trap to attract our little house guest. Next morning, food was gone, but the trap hadn't activated. Thought it might be a fluke, so I tried it again. Same result. Don't waste your money.

I don't know if this is a piece of crap, or if my home is infested with like the world's smartest mice, but this thing has been locked and loaded for a month and NADA. Still seeing mice, on occasion, but they have no interest in this item no matter what I fill it with.
summary: It's not you, it's my mice

reviewText:
It seems like mice have gone in and out of the trap but the trap mechanism just won't trigger. I've had it for maybe two weeks now and it seems that mice have been going in and out and nibbling the bits of cupcake I put inside, as evidenced by increasing amounts of mouse feces on the inside of the trap.
