And believe me, I think I've set the trap right. It's also much smaller than what the picture leads you to believe. Pictures to follow.

Avoid!
summary: The trap mechanism won't trigger. Pictures to follow. Avoid!

reviewText:
Can you give me one valid reason why green and not fully transparent?
Why no clear indication (like LED or a reflective tape) to indicate from a distance that the trap is closed?

By the time I saw that there was a mouse in the trap, the mouse was already dead - because I saw neither that the trap door was closed, nor that there was a mouse inside the trap - due to the two reasons mentioned in the questions above.

I thought I would wait a while until I tried to use it before writing a review. This thing has been completely useless. I followed all the instructions carefully, put all the food in there, placed it in almost every part of the house and the mouse totally ignores it. He still lives here today and it has been over a month now.
summary: Sorry, but this has been useless

reviewText: I set this trap in the same location with same bait as Havahart trap on three separate occasions. Each time, I caught a mouse in the Havahart mouse trap & released it 5 miles away. This trap did absolutely nothing. Spend the extra $4 and get  a Havahart mouse trap.

I guess you could say it works at catching mice but what's the point of being able to catch them if it won't hold them. The mouse got out after being caught. He left his poop and he ate the peanut butter and then he figured out an exit, which has to have been the door that snaps shut. I guess if you have a stupid mouse, this trap will work, but if you have one of those smart mice, like I do, it won't work.
summary: Caught the mouse but not for long

reviewText: I purchased this because I have a small mouse OR vole eating my vegetables.  I placed a cracker with peanut butter on it inside the trap.  Well, the mouse outsmarted the trap because the cracker was gone.  I placed a second cracker inside the trap and again the mouse took the cracker without getting caught.  This trap did not work for me.

This mouse trap is too small. I had food in the very back, small pieces of food, and the mice were able to take the food out without triggering the device. I haven't caught a single one with this. Disappointed, because it seems it would work well if it was larger.

This trap needs more vents!!  I checked the trap several times while I was home, and no mouse.  Then a mouse was trapped while I was at work, and when I came home, the mouse was dead.  I felt absolutely terrible.  The whole point of me purchasing this "humane" trap was to avoid hurting an animal!!  There was a lot on condensation on the inside of the trap, and I assume the poor thing suffocated.  If you buy this trap, make sure you drill more ventilation holes.

I am very disappointed with this trap. My mouse got in, ate the cracker and got back out without setting off the trap and then never went in it again. After resetting the trap three times, the thing that holds the door open wouldn't hold it open anymore so it was a complete waste of money. I'm now on day 12 of having a mouse in my house and on my second live trap from somewhere else. I think the cracker I gave him was so much food that he's stored it and isn't hungry yet.

Three nights in a row we've set the trap and the mouse has run in, grabbed the cracker with peanut butter and ran back out. Not sure why the trap isn't closing on the mouse, we're sure its a mouse since we've had a few sitings already.
summary: Our mouse is getting well fed from this trap

reviewText:
I'm sorry but this doesn't work at all. I watched mice walk in and out of the trap. It's funny it's shaped like a home, because that's what it is for mice.

If they're in your house, too bad for them. I wussed out. Now there's bait and spring traps everywhere.
summary: A humane mouse trap for: a (Money) trap for humans, not Mice

reviewText: It didn't work! I have no idea what I'm doing wrong. I tried peanut butter, cheese, crackers, trail mix, all different things (not all at once) and nothing worked. Plus, the hinge weakens and the trap gets ultra sensitive the more you set it... no good. I didn't want to have to kill this mouse but this thing doesn't work!!

As others have noted, the mouse can chew through the door hinges.  I checked in the morning after setting the trap the night before, and bingo, the WHOLE DOOR was gone.  Took me a while to find it.  Apparently, the mouse got trapped, ate through the cheap plastic hinge of the door, and was gone.  STUPID DESIGN!  STUPID PRODUCT!

Don't bother getting this thing out. It is not worth the time and effort to get out and wash because if your apple isn't the perfect size and shape it will skip all over the apple and only peel small sections here and there. Forget about it!
summary: What a waste of my time and money

reviewText: Should the batteries happen to die midway through opening a can...you're out of luck.  The opener will not disengage from the can (you REALLY can't yank it off of there!), and the batteries cannot be replaced while it's still clamped down on the can.  I don't know what knucklehead came up with that design idea, but I think he or she needs to find another line of work.

I have had this can opener for 3 weeks and I cut my finger today. The can opener opens cans by chopping off the entire lid. That leaves a razor sharp edge on the top of the can. I put a spoon in the can to remove food and cut my finger on the sharp edge. Hands-free isn't better than a conventional can opener when it causes injury.
summary: This is dangerous! Do not buy this!

reviewText: I purchased one of these and it died. I thought it was something I did wrong so I purchased another one. The second one came to me half dead and much smaller than the first one.  It died completely 3 days later. Poor quality product, do not buy this item.

I was given this as a gift, it is NOT worth the money. It's loud, doesn't drive straight, hard to push, does a TERRIBLE job, and I've already had it serviced to try and fix some of the problems. I can go around and pick up lint and dirt by scraping my hand over the carpet after I've vacuumed - and do a better job (and I'm not making that up!!)I'm finally going to replace it with something that works and hope that the gift-giver doesn't notice ;)

I purchased the Oreck five years ago and wish I had not.  I suppose that it can suck up a bowling ball.  I have a dog and a cat, and the vacuum clogs rapidly.  It is not easy to unclog.  I have brought the vacuum in for unclogging several times.  I am now looking for another vacuum and will be disposing of the Oreck XL very shortly.  For the amount that a new Oreck sells for, it is vastly over priced.  For its quality of performance, the price should not be more than $100.

This Mix 'n Chop is a must have and sells for $11.50 in the Pampered Chef catalog. You are being ripped off if you buy Pampered Chef product from this seller. Go to [...] and search your zip code for a consultant in your area. He/She will gladly help you with your purchase and can even save you money on shipping. Remember, the only way you get The Pampered Chef warranty is by buying your products directly from the company.
summary: Don't get ripped off by buying Pampered Chef products here

reviewText:
We have a masonry heater with two large glass windows.  This is a high temperature wood burning heater.  The only way I have found to reliably remove soot/creosote from the glass is with a razor blade.  Based on the high ratings of this product I had high hopes.

Unfortunately it did not even make a dent in the soot/creosote on the glass.  I followed the instructions as provided. I was able to get a small amount off but only with a ton of elbow grease.
summary: Worth a try but did not touch high temperature soot on glass.

reviewText: Bought one and it arrived and did not work.  Bought another one and it arrived in the same condition.  Called American Weigh and they offered to send me one that works if I sent them the defective one.  This somehow did not seem like a good deal.  The seller was not helpful either.  Amazon of course is the best and they are picking it up and refunding the cost.

This scale is not accurate over 200 grams.  At first the scale seems to track linearly and then when a second and equal amount is added, the weight does not double.  In fact, at some points, as I am adding weight, the readout starts dropping.  So obviously there is a problem with this unit but one would never know without using calibrated weights.  And the scale is only a couple of years old.  I'll be looking for a different scale this time.

I chose this reason because I ordered this, and didn't get it; ordered it again; didn't get it. Ordered it again, they just gave my money back. I don't know what the problem was, but I'd still  like to try it, it just doesn't seem to be possible.

I am very disappointed!  I first used it 3 days ago.  I have moved the sprinklers 6-8 times and one of the hoses broke OFF.  The end was screwed into the sprinkler and when I lifted it  the hose was laying on the ground. It was completely sheared off.  I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND PURCHASING.
summary: I am very disappointed! I first used it 3 days ago

reviewText: We have hard ground - it's almost impossible to get the rather large plastic spikes on the sprinklers into the ground far enough to hold the sprinklers in place. The construction seems flimsy - one of the connectors on the set we ordered was broken when we opened the box. Also, the hoses that come with these are 1/2 diameter and rather flimsy, which means water flow (especially for the second and third sprinklers) tends to be low. There are much better solutions our there.

I ordered two sets of this system.  It was a waste of money.  The hoses broke off from the connections on 3 out of the 6 sprinklers I ordered.  I glued them on with Gorilla Glue, being careful not to block the water flow.  However, the water never reached the third sprinkler even with the faucet on full force.  The sprinklers that got water just gurgled and never got to a full spray.  It's just not worth sending them back.  I'll eat the cost and throw them away.
summary: It was a waste of money

reviewText: This Item does not deserve a star at all but zero star is not an option.  We purchased a set similar to this one last year and wanted to add to it (the old set still works fine)  however, this set  is poorly made.  While trying to connect them, all three of the hose connectors broke from the sprinkler heads with the slightest pull on the hose.  I don't know who made them but they are of very poor quality.

I don't know the name of the part that I want to discuss.  It is the part that screws into the faucet or hose.  Whatever it is called, all three on the sprinkler system I received broke at the neck as soon as I put the sprinkler on the ground.  The hose was at a slight angle to the what-do-you-call-it and it just snapped.  I don't think I am strong enough to have broken it by handling it. I have never had this happen before no matter how cheap the hose or sprinkler was.
summary: with 3 in 1 you get what you pay for, or maybe less

reviewText: We bought this triple spray sprinkler system to extend a similar system we already had.  It is made of light weight plastic and one of the sprayers broke in the process of putting it into the ground.  Every part of the system is very delicate and prone to breakage.  Because they will be used in a lawn, they will have to be removed every time in order to mow--and the other sprayers and the attachments to the hose will no doubt break too.  VERY POOR QUALITY!

It would almost be okay if our colors were maroon, white and blue. The color is horrible and I mean horrible.  The blue has white speckles in it (on one of my flags) and the grommets are different sizes. I could live with the last two issues if the colors were correct. Did I mention that the color is horrible? You should not waste your money on this product. I wish I hadn't.

I bought this because we needed a bag to store our tree and put it in storage. We put our tree in, which was 7 ft tall, and as soon as my husband went to pick it up, the bag ripped and he was left with the handles in his hand and the tree and bag on the floor.

In short, this burner is rubbish for the simple fact that the buttons respond only occasionally when pressed so you are never quite sure if it is going to work.  I  regret not having read the Cook's Illustrated reviews prior to purchasing it because now I am stuck with a product I find unusable.  A complete waste of money. I imagine the other reviews are by people who are getting subsidized to write nice things.
summary: Are these people getting paid to write these reviews?

reviewText: I purchased this a while back. I have tried using it on several occasions to do iron on transfers. Following instructions on the iron and on the iron on transfers, I was disappointed to find that it did not work. This product is a waste of money. Do not buy!

One of the bolts that supports the back of the chair came out. (It's inside the fabric and you can not get to it to fix it without cutting it) The chair was in storage for a period of time and the warranty time ran out before noticing the defect. So it lasted less than six months and now it's useless.
summary: So it lasted less than six months and now it's useless.

reviewText: The 'bonded leather' has started to wear off. It has been a few years, but still I have not mistreated the chair and you would expect it to last longer. Fairly disappointed. Buy real leather if you can afford it because it will last you longer and look better.
summary: Fairly disappointed. Buy real leather if you can afford it ...

reviewText: I bought this chair back in January.  It sits pretty low to the ground so I have to raise it up all the way.  About a month ago, the shock started giving out and now it will not stay raised at all.  I didn't really expect this to last very long but I thought I would at least get a year or two out of it.

Comfortable - for a while. This chair is unfortunately very poor quality. The "leather" arms and seat and back starts to peel after a while, and the mechanism that holds it to the feet becomes loose and it wobbles real bad. After a while it started to tilt to one side. I didn't get two years of intermittent use out of this chair before it went into the garbage where it belongs.
summary: Comfortable but very poor quality. Not durable at all, wears out very fast.

reviewText: After only a few short months, of hardly being used, the chair sinks to the floor every time you sit in it.  Use the lever to raise the chair back up, sit down, and it sinks back to the floor again within a couple mins.. Although fun, it is irritating when you can no longer see over your desk...
summary: Although fun, it is irritating when you can no longer ...

reviewText: This is the second of these chairs I have purchased. The first one was great until the "leather plus" began to peel off after about five years. The new chairs seat is pillowed up in the center center making it uncomfortable to sit in. I've had some medical issues to deal with and didn't get around to testing this chair until now. According to Amazon it's too late to return it so I guess I'm stuck. I'm begining to wonder if shopping locally might be a better option for a chair like this.

This chair is very uncomfortable.  It took me forever to find something that would even make it bearable to sit in all day and finally I found something that cost me $50.  I have no idea why the seat is so hard, but it is and it makes my tailbone hurt so much I can hardly last all day in it.  Do yourself a favor and buy another chair - not this one!

left hand arm on chair broke.  It cracked in half where one of the screws attach it to the chair.  I haven't even had this chair for a month yet.  I am very unhappy with the fact that this chair broke in less than a month and it appears that I can't return it.  I would like a replacement arm for my chair..  The arm in question is the left hand side if you are sitting in the chair.  I like the chair but just need a replacement arm.
summary: arm broke after less than a month

reviewText: The leather has peeled off all over the place and the house is full of little pieces of this crap.  Really hate it.  Anyone have a chair that is still being sold and you've had it and been happy with it at least five years?  If so, please let us know--my son has multiple back fractures and really needs a good chair.  THIS SITS WELL, but I wish I was kidding about all of the leather peeling off--it is a horrible MESS!
summary: Leather peels off leaving a MESS

reviewText: The lowest height of this chair is too high.  My feet barely touch the floor and I'm 5'11.  The moment I lean back, I'm on my tippy toes.  The comfort of this chair is poor.  The seat is shallow and ends mid thigh.  The quality is also poor, and my chair has started to fall apart and wobble during the first month.

I bought this chair and twenty others of a different brand.  I bought them all at the same time 90 days ago.  This one broke.  The other brand chairs are all in perfect condition.  If you want a chair that lasts for less than 3 months, buy this one.

I bought this chair about 1.5 years ago from Costco and need to say this is a worst investment I have ever done. Started to squeak very loud 6 months after I bought it (I weigh 130lb). No way to put oil inside, no way to fix squeaking.

Way too big and what is the most important I developed neck problems while using this chair. My neck is getting better since I threw that **** away. I wasn't even feeling like selling or giving it to anyone, just threw it away.

Don't waste your money, stay away.

I like this chair except for one major defect - IT SQUEAKS LIKE CRAZY! When I lean back in the chair, then set up straight, there's always these annoying squeaks. I'm even considering trashing the chair and getting a new one. BEWARE!!!

Like other reviewers mentioned, this chair squeaks a lot. I had it for 2 days, and it started squeaking. Now I'm required to lubricate the location where it makes the noises every two weeks. After a several months, lubrication no longer fixes the noise, it constantly squeaks whenever I moved a bit. I'm sensitive to these noises. I really hate this chair.

I asked my husband to get me a nice leather desk chair for Christmas. I didn't want to hurt his feelings so now I'm stuck with this and it's a total rip-off. Read more about bonded "leather" and you'll find out it can be only 10% leather! This chair cost him $200 and is cheap, black rubber. I absolutely hate it.
summary: CHEAP BONDED LEATHER is really expensive rubber!

reviewText: I used to have a metal gumdrop tree and loved it, this is not the same.  After my metal one broke last year and I have not been able to find a replacement, I bought this one to replace it for this year.  It is so lightweight I worry it will break all the time, and if you don't take the gumdrops off evenly around the tree it will fall over.  Maybe it works better for money?

I've had this kettle for months and keep hoping that I'll be able to get rid of the plastic flavor in the water it boils, but it's hopeless.  It ruins the flavor of tea, but is also probably harming anyone who drinks it.
summary: Strong smell and taste of plastic

reviewText: These things flop over in water. If you're not just using them as dry decorations, don't even bother. They will be face down in whatever wet surface you put them in. I put them in the punch for my son's birthday party. They were all face down in the punch. So yeah. A rubber ducky that can't stay up in water isn't much of a rubber ducky.

BUYER BEWARE!! Top of the pic has been cropped off, and the color is horribly washed-out -nearly grey and white rather than the stunning blue and yellow of the original painting. Don't be fooled by the pic shown on the page. I bought an Edward Hopper poster from the same seller and was very satisfied with it, but this doesn't even look like the painting.
summary: and the color is horribly washed-out -nearly grey and white rather than the stunning ...

reviewText: in the image they show, the top of the large tree isn't cropped off. in the actual product it is cropped off. the image quality is poor as well. if it weren't cropped and blown up i would have probably kept it.
summary: this wasn't what i expected, it was enlarged, had poor quality, and it was cropped

reviewText: The one I received leaks terribly.  It will not hold water any longer than a couple of minutes.  Also, the foam roller - sponge on the bottom seems so cheap that it would shred easily.  I do not in any way recommend spending $38 on this item.  Perhaps $20, and be prepared to use lots of sealant on it.  Plus, pray the foam roller on the bottom is tougher than it looks.

I thought it was battery operated.  Very disappointing, there is no cord at all.  There's a button for water output.  However, the only thing to retract water, is a small roller sponge.  You have to roll back and forth.  I did not actually try it out, but I don't think a small roller will extract much water at all.

This is not a 3-quart slow cooker.  I bought this to replace a 3-quart that bit the dust.  The stoneware fits entirely inside my old 3 - quart.  Thought maybe I was cracking up, so I measured out 3 quarts of water - which did NOT fit inside this slow cooker.  It does say "3 quart capacity" which I guess is their way of saying - "you might be able to fit almost 3 quarts of liquid in this but you won't be able to stir it or put the lid on".  Yikes!  Poor product!

The outside covering is loose and flimsy material. My other "crockpot" coverings all adhere to the "crockpot" unit. This one does not. Hope that will not affect its operation. Have already used it (one time) and it seems to work okay. We'll see how long it lasts.

In theory this sounded great.  However, when I tried to use it I realized it was a disaster waiting to happen.  It is VERY wobbly so it wasn't worth taking the chance of having a kitchen disaster.  I tried reinforcing it with large paper clips to no avail.  Since I threw out the original packaging, I wound up trashing it.  Sure wish it would have been more stable.
summary: In theory this sounded great. However

reviewText: VERY DISAPPOINTING.  My first clue should have been all of the customers who bought them for their embroidery projects.  The description by the manufacturer is that they are absorbant.  They are NOT absorbant.  I suppose if you want to embroider they are fine.  But to use as an absorbant dish towel they are not at all up to the job.  :(

I had been looking for large heavy duty dishtowels like these.  The quality is great and they come nicely hemmed.  BUT they won't dry a thing.  I've washed them multiple times thinking there was a "sizing" issue but they still won't dry my dishes.  Disappointed!
summary: I had been looking for large heavy duty dishtowels like these. The quality is great and they come ...

reviewText: I probably should have returned the towels after opening the package. There was a terrible chemical smell that took two wash cycles with a cup of vinegar in each cycle (along with laundry soap) to remove the smell. Also, one of the towels has a hole in it. I purchased these towels because they were so highly rated. I won't be purchasing them again.
summary: Maybe I didn't receive the same towels as every else?

reviewText: These towels are not absorbent which is the whole purpose of a "towel". They are stiff, not soft. Perfect for embroidery if you just want a towel for display. I have washed them a few times with no change.

This stuff does not work. I only bought this after using it at Hyatt regency. I should have checked if it worked before leaving the town. Will be returning this item when I get back home from traveling
summary: Does not heat up (steamer does not work)

reviewText: This thing says it's for travel and is 'compact' in size.  It's bigger than one of my shoes (and I wear a size 15).  I can only say that it never made it any further than out of the box and right back in.
summary: Not what I thought it would be

reviewText: The only good thing about this product is the capacity of water. What is wrong with this product? 1. It takes at least three minutes to warm up. 2. No brush, no turn on or off. 3. The water boiled but it does not steam enough to do the work. Since you cannot stop the steam to get to the plug to turn it off, it is very very dangerous! I opened it, tried it for five minutes and it is costing me $6.95 to return!

I'm very disappointed with this product.  I have tried steaming clothes of all different materials and am not able to get any real results.  I am not a picky consumer - in fact I think this is the only negative review I've written for a product I've purchased.  Do yourself a favor and don't buy this product.

When I was growing up these were all the rage. But those came with feet and these just lay in the yard because there are no feet. I see that I am not the only one who has to do that. Perhaps I can learn to magically make them levitate! So frustrating and tossing them on the ground seriously detracts from the positives, they are pretty useless without the feet.

I am very dissatisfied with this product, Rhode Island Novelty and Amazon! I didn't get legs for these birds it seems to be a problem for many people. I contacted Rhode Island Novelty and Amazon and did not get a response from anyone. All I want is the rest of my order. It's not worth the money to send them back.
summary: No legs and no help from Amazon!

reviewText: This company sent a damaged product to me. When I opened the box, I found one of the birds is already damaged and I'm pretty sure the damage is already there before it was shipped. Shame on this company!!! Bad business!!!!!

These spikes may work for large birds like pigeons or sea gulls, but they do not work for smaller birds like robins or wrens. They just land between the spikes and build their nest in a "protected" area behind the spikes. The company should identify that they are effective only for large birds. I need a system with smaller spikes spaced much closer.
summary: These spikes may work for large birds like pigeons or sea gulls

reviewText: We have a lot of problems with pigeons.  We tried a few different things and then decided these were the way to go.  I wish they worked.  If anything, I think the pigeons like having "decorations" around their pooping ground.  They're also pretty flimsy and takes a while to find a really good placement for them.  Not worth it, pigeons and their poop still everywhere.
summary: I think the pigeons like having "decorations" around their pooping ground

reviewText: The birds continued to roost on spikes.  I placed the spikes on a small ledge on the interior of my front porch.  The birds didn't seem to mind the spikes at all.  I ended up nailing a block of wood on the ledge to eliminate the space for the two birds.

One of the worst traps I have purchased.  The glue that supposedly keeps it together just collapses.  When you check the trap, it's flattened out and stuck together.  I do not recommend.  I had to dispose  of at  least four of them due to the glue not  holding up.

Extremely disappointed with this product.  I have tons of pantry moths zooming around.  Every time I open the pantry door, moths fly out.  These traps have been set up exactly as instructed for over a week and not one moth has been trapped so far.  I would not waste my money on these.

These traps are covered with very strong adhesive glue. I was unable to put them together because the glue from one side caught the other and it was impossible to pull apart. They were worthless to me.

I bought these and the Catchmaster Pantry Moth Traps.  With these, the moths walked on the glue, then flew away---I caught maybe four.  With the Catchmaster, the glue is very sticky---when the moth touches the glue, he is stuck---I caught around thirty.  Buy the Catchmaster.

The Magic Halo was a waste of money for me. It has not reduced feeder visits by house sparrows at all. In fact, the sparrows use it as a perch before swooping down to the feeder. The only saving grace is that some desirable birds also perch on it, but as for keeping sparrows away, don't believe the hype.

I bought one of these chairs and it has been a disaster since I assembled it. The screws won't stay in place and the chair is falling apart. It's comfortable--I love the concept, but this model is a hunk of junk. I plan to fork out the money for one of the Norwegian built chairs. I had one of those for over 20 years and I wore out the upholstery. The frame was as solid as ever.

This has a 1-4 scale. When I brought this home I tested a plant I had not watered in a week, it read 2. I tested the plant next to it that I had watered earlier the same day, it read 2. I stuck it in a glass of water, it read 3.

According to the directions I should have watered all of the above. If followed the directions my plants would all die of over watering in no time.

Unfortunately this Moisture Meter/Tester didn't work at all and I was able to show the supplier
with a picture that my old tester was working fine but theirs didn't work at all. They promised
me a full refund.
summary: ... with a picture that my old tester was working fine but theirs didn't work at all

reviewText: I almost killed my plants because of this meter. It said that my plants were soaking when there wasn't any water in them. After a week of seeing the meter's needle hit 10+, I stopped using it and started using my finger to test the soil and my plants have started doing well again. Save yourself the headache and don't waste your money on this product.

This thing is a piece of junk. Does not work in any of my potted plants and I used my old Instamatic Moisture Meter and, at least it registers on the meter. Very disappointed in the product and if I could find a new (unused) Instamatic
Moisture Meter I would buy it. Stay away from this product!

Really doesn't work.  Tried several times.  Does not give me a true reading of the amount of moisture in the soil of my Bonsai plants.  Quit using it for fear of killing my plants by not watering them enough.

I read the reviews, saw some that said it did not work, but some that said it worked great.  I thought, well, I will try it and maybe mine will work.  It did not work.  It registered everything as dry even though, to test it, I put it in plants that had been well watered.  Don't waste your time and money on this.

Don't waste your money. This a different model, but similar to one by the same manufacturer that lasted for a couple of months before breaking. This one didn't work at all. (Registered dry in muddy soil.)

The first one of these I bought lasted about 4 months and then stopped working.  The second one I bought worked fine, but when I tried to use it the following Summer it stopped working.  This product is unreliable and not worth wasting your money on.

I was looking forward to using this product after all the positive Amazon reviews. Right out of the package, the black plastic "handle" piece never stayed in place. Not a big deal, I thought and just continued to use it, careful to hold the handle in place while using it. Then 2 months after the purchase, the probe CAME OFF the internal wiring. It's very disappointing. I'll be looking for a new soil moisture meter.

Right out of the package, this meter did not work.  I tried it in a relatively dry plant - it registered dry.  I tried it in a very moist plant - it registered dry. Every plant I tried it with registered exactly the same!

THIS ITEM IS JUNK.  EVEN THE PACKAGING IS JUNK.  THE METER IS FLKIMSY AND THE ONE I PURCHASED DID NOT WORK EVEN ONCE.  A COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY AND MY GARDENING TIME.  IT WOULD BE A NICE SURPRISE TO NOT BE TAKEN FOR A RIDE ON CHEAPLY MADE PRODUCTS.  IT DOESN'T DESERVE A STAR BUT I HAD TO GIVE IT ONE SO THE THE REVIEW WOULD WORK.

I bought this moisture meter for my partner, who loves gardening. Unfortunately, I gave it to him as a Christmas present, and by the time he needed to use it (i.e., actually opened the package) in the Spring, we found that it didn't work. Not one bit. And, of course, it was too late to get any kind of refund from Amazon. What a waste of $$.

The first few times I used it, I had no issue.  True it didn't give off very much light but I was fine with that.  But on the 5th time lighting the wick, the oil had clogged it and it was not burning properly at all and I thought a fire was going to be started. Not buying this again.

It does do what it claims, but so would just letting the juices cool enough to form a crust of fat and then spooning it off. It is a little awkward to use and almost impossible to clean the grease after use. It is made of plastic and the grease clings to every surface including the tiny molded spout. If it was made out of glass and had a more accessible spout for cleaning maybe I would use it, but it will probably go to Goodwill.

As others have observed, the lids do not stay closed.  Six of the buckles on the ten that I bought do not latch.  If it wasn't called "portable" I'd give it two stars instead of one but this is only portable if you don't mind picking up all your stuff off the floor as you walk around.

These took almost two months to be delivered. Once I got them, of the 10, seven of them had broken clips. The ones that did not have broken clips did not clip together properly and kept popping open. Needless to say, I'm not using them.

I purchased this to hang my hummingbird feeder, which it was advertised to do, but after 3 days, it fell and the feeder was destroyed.  Then I tried just hanging it without anything hanging from it, and the same thing happened.  I made sure that I cleaned the window really well before I attached the hanger, but it didn't make any difference.

This thing is so difficult to open that after 10 mins of trying to twist it apart, I threw it in the trash with the garlic in it. Someone needs to rethink the ease of use for opening and closing these storage containers.

The muddler I received does not look like the one in the picture. It is short. Not the 12 inch one you see here. I don't know if the shipper sent the wrong one or if it is just false advertising. If you want a dinky muddler, you can get it for half the price of this one. The one I received does not say KEGWORKS on the side.

I wish I had done the math before buying this. In room humidifiers usually hold at least 0.75 gallons (3 liters). These cups are smaller than a pint (half a liter), and it barely evaporates water. So unless your radiator is super hot and you are humidifying a closet, do yourself a favor and buy a conventional electric humidifier.

ZeroWater has continually reduced the lifespan of these filters. Originally, they lasted over a month. Then they changed the design and the filters lasted about 3 weeks. Now, more recently, they changed the design again (the new ones have flat blue o-rings), and they last only one week. I have been a customer for over 5 years, now I'm never buying these filters again. Instead, I'm going to use a countertop reverse osmosis filter.

The quality of these filters is very variable and the water they produce has an unpleasant taste, which gets worse as time goes by.  Our tap water is just over 200 ppm tds.  In a matter of days, the water in the filter pitcher went from 8 ppm to over 500 ppm.  The filter actually made the water worse than tap water.

This batch of has a lot of beads that make it into the water. I'm told they are non toxic, but I don't like giving guests water with beads floating in it. Although the problem gets worse with time, it also happened as soon as I replaced the filter. I am transitioning to using a different brand of filter even though i have not finished using these filters.
summary: Water looks dirtier after filtering than before.

reviewText: I have purchased these water filters before and I've not had a problem but the receipts that I bought was not consistent. Two of the filters did not work and there were black fragments coming through the water filter. I contacted customer service and they were of no help whatsoever. I also contacted Amazon and they could not help me either. Very unfortunate.
summary: I have purchased these water filters before and I've not ...

reviewText: I bought this pitcher the end of November and I've had it less than 6 months and the spout no longer works, when I asked the company a way to fix it, they told me they were sorry but they couldn't help me!
summary: I bought this pitcher the end of November and I've ...

reviewText:
The first filter in the package was great - lasted about 3 months.  The second filter only lasted about two weeks, and the third filter did not work at all - it registered 007 on the first day it was in use.

I don't know if they are selling refurbished filters, but that is ridiculously bad performance.
summary: Registered a 007 Purity on First Use - NOT GOOD!

reviewText: I had the same problem that everyone on the internet complains about - after ten to 12 days, the water starts to taste Metallic, then gets worse and worse, to the point where it's undrinkable. I wish there was a filter that removed Flouride. I'll take chlorine if I have to, but I don't like Nazi-era crap in my water. That's why I bought this originally, but it's too much to keep changing filters that regularly.

I have used these before.  They seem to start having microbeads and charcoal in the top section very quickly.  Today, I cleaned the pitcher and installed a new filter.  After filling the top reservoir one time, there is charcoal.  After filling the top reservoir 3 times, there is charcoal and microbeads.  This happens, sometimes quickly, but, not usually this quickly.  Not good vs. bad vs. very bad?  I got this for my Keurig but the microbeads are killing it.  We will be switching water filter systems.

These are awful!  After a short time (about 2 weeks), the water takes on a fishy smell and taste.  It reminds me of seaweed.
I'm going to throw away the whole system and get something else.  Terrible purchase on my part.

Short use life span. Each filter only lasts a couple of weeks and the flavor of the water is foul at the end of the filter's life. Distinct fishy flavor at the end. The tap water we are using to fill it doesn't have the fishy flavor. We will go back to purchasing gallons of bottled water as it is less expensive in California and the same purity level.
summary: Each filter only lasts a couple of weeks and the flavor of the water is foul at the end of the filter's life

reviewText: We've used ZeroWater for a year now and the filters never last long. When they lose effectiveness the water has a very unpleasant odor which I find hard to believe doesn't come from the material inside the filters. The filters are extremely expensive. The filtered water doesn't taste any different than water filtered by any of the other name brand filters and doesn't taste nearly as good as water filtered by reverse osmosis.

I bought the ZEROWATER  system. I did not see a small map of the USA pointing out the pollution levels per state. Arizona is the worst. A filter in Phoenix will filter about 6 gallons. This is TOO EXPENSIVE. The cost is over $1.00 per gallon. I will not reorder. I like the dispenser but will use bottled water at $.20 per gallon to fill it. I wish I had known the high cost. I would never have purchased ZEROWATER. It is not a bargain. STAY AWAY and buy bottled water.

When I bought the unit it came with a filter. After the second refill the water tasted sour. I thought I had done some thing to cause this, so I bought the 4-pack. The first filter started doing the same thing. Just after the second refill the water started tasting sour. I am very disappointed with this product.
summary: I am very disappointed with this product

reviewText: When the filter is new, the water tastes great.  But after 2.5 weeks, it started tasted 'lemon-y' so we would replace the filters.  It's a pretty expensive filter to replace every 2.5 weeks.  After some Google-ing, we found out that lemon-y taste was due to the pH of the water becoming acidic because of the filter.  Won't be using ZeroWater filters any more.
summary: Had to replace very 2.5 weeks.  Lemon taste.

reviewText: I RECEIVED MY REPLACEMENT FILTERS ON FRIDAY THE 17th AND INSTALLED AND TESTED THE FIRST GLASS WHICH TESTED GREAT!  BY MONDAY THE 20th THE FILTER WAS DONE!!!  THIS SYSTEM IS WAY TOO EXPENSIVE TO BE REPLACING THE FILTERS EVERY WEEK!  THE WATER TASTED GOOD WHEN THE FILTERS WORK! THEY JUST DO NOT WORK FOR VERY LONG!!!!!!!!!
summary: ... AND INSTALLED AND TESTED THE FIRST GLASS WHICH TESTED GREAT! BY MONDAY THE 20th THE FILTER WAS DONE

reviewText: ZERO WATER IS VERY EXPENSIVE!!! THE FILTERS ONLY LASTED 1 WEEK!!!  THE LAST FILTER I ORDERED FROM AMAZON WAS INSTALLED ON FRIDAY THE 17TH AND BY MONDAY THE 20TH IT WAS NO LONGER GOOD, THAT WAS ONLY 3 DAYS.  AT THE PRICE OF THE FILTERS IT IS NOT A SOUND INVESTMENT.
summary: THE LAST FILTER I ORDERED FROM AMAZON WAS INSTALLED ON FRIDAY THE 17TH AND BY MONDAY THE 20TH IT WAS NO LONGER GOOD, THAT WAS ON

reviewText: I bought two in advance, I went to open one last night and it does not filter out like it normally does. It'll filter out literally a few drops and then it stops. It took the entire night to filter out, when it normally only takes about 5 to 10 minutes. So I opened up the other one and it's literally falling apart on the inside. I emailed them yesterday and have still yet to receive a response.

Quality has dramatically deteriorated. When you look at the picture of their filter it shows that it is full of filtration material inside. Now pick up the actual filter and look it up next to a window and see how much filtration material is actually inside. Barely a little over 50%. But this is not all that bad if it would work. Problem is it does not. Water does not drain and they refuse to do anything about it.
summary: This company is on it's last leg

reviewText:
Those were a good product in the past. Within the last few batches they don't last more than a few weeks or a month. Not sure if I'll keep going this route.

Update 05-2016: Gets even worse, the last batch with 3 filters: One doesn't filter at all, no water flow. The other two didn't last more than a couple weeks.
summary: Those were a good product in the past

reviewText: I don't know what is wrong with these filters, but they're not the same quality as the ones I buy at Bed Bath & Beyond. The sand and other stuff of the filter is coming out and I never had this happen before. They're so expensive and I will never buy from this seller again!

When they changed the style of the filter the resultant water flow has decreased.  It can now take hours for the water to drain through the filter.  We are using the filters in a ZeroWater Bottle filtration system that is supposed to replace 5 gallon bottles.  I will be looking for another type of filtration system.  I have decided that filtered water that sits in plastic isn't very good for me anyway, and since this has become frustrating it is time to switch.
summary: Not as good as it was

reviewText: I have been using the Zero water system for a while and decided to order the 8 pack filters to save a bit.  These filters are NOT the same as regular zero water filters.  They are not sealed.  The tops come off and the filter material leaks out. These are very poor quality compared to "regular" zero water filters. I like the system, but am going to have to find a new source for filters.

I could not fall asleep because it was impossible to keep this pillow in one place during my back to back five-hour flights. I tried readjusting it over and over and it wasn't working. I watched the video several times trying to figure out what I was doing wrong and I could not. When you're in coach on a plane it's basically impossible to get this situated comfortably. I wish I could return it but I'm past the return date. I should just pay extra to get in first class.
summary: Impossible to Keep This Pillow in One Place

reviewText: I am not sure why this doesn't work but it slips out from our hold and doesn't really stay in place.  Also no one else wants to put their mouth on the inflating tube since we don't know who last did that.  ugh!
summary: doesn't really work - wish I could return it

reviewText:
I tried using this "Ultimate Travel Pillow" on 2 separate occasions in the last 3 weeks. The first time I ended up with a slight cut on my neck because the edge of the item was stiff and sharp - like a paper cut. The second time I woke up in  pain from having slept with my neck at an awkward angle.
I thought I had enough time to return this, but the window closed the day before I was due to fly back - so I'm stuck with it.

This was a waste of money.  It is almost impossible to keep it stationary. The woman in the picture looks very restful but who sleeps in such an upright position with her head.  Everything I tried to keep it stationary failed.  It is a nice concept but in reality it didn't work.
summary: This was a waste of money

reviewText: GROSS! Do not buy this pillow! I received the pillow intact but riddled with gray and white hair. YUCK! And the logo was peeling with scratches on it. The pillow I received had obviously been used and abused and why in the world would I want to put my face on it? Absolutely DISGUSTING!
summary: Do not buy! Sending used pillows!

reviewText: I took this thing to Europe. I woke up every few minutes to try to inflate the thing. I gave up. Because it didn't hold air, it gave no support. I slept like crap. And it's a 7 to 8 hour flight. That's not a good way to travel. Now I'm going to back to the little horse-shoe pillow, which I also hate, but at least it doesn't deflate.

I bought the item and was pretty happy with it. It inflated easily and seemed comfortable. However, after the few weeks, a piece broke off the pillow. This was a small plastic disk which sat in the neck of the pillow and made it inflatable. Once this broke off, it no longer inflated. Terrible design flaw and it is now junk.
summary: Flimsy - broke in a few weeks

reviewText: I bought two of these, one for me and one for my wife. We both hated them. I opted to just lean my head back on the airline-supplied pillow rather than try to use this thing. I only wish I could get my money back. Next trip, I will buy one of those U-shaped pillows.

My mom ordered this for three of us before a trip to Europe. Other than providing a lot of laughter while she inflated it (and it took far more than the 3 or 4 puffs other reviewers claim), it was of no value at all.

As you can see from the photo, there's nothing to keep your head from falling forward - and unless you're in a fully-reclining seat, that's bound to happen. It's also too thin to prevent your head from falling farther to the side than is comfortable.
summary: Other than comic relief, no benefit

reviewText:
Bombilla rusted and corroded within two months. I used it ONCE, and I dried it off after. The spring is covered with rust and corrosion. I kept it in a dry, cool place. There is no reason it should have rusted this quickly. I would give this zero stars if I could.

The gourd is fine, but the metal is a bit cheap. If this was just the gourd, I would give it 3 stars, but the bombilla getting so rusty after one use is disgusting.

I bought these for privacy, so our dog couldn't see every single person passing our house. But I had to return them because they did not serve the purpose. The willows are too far apart and you can see right through them.

Everyone has their weakness and mine is pillow (and pocketbooks). I buy a new pillow almost every month and have tried so many different kinds and brands I can't keep track. I'm always on the hunt for a comfortable pillow that may help my neck and back pain. This is definitely not it. It came rolled up and after trying to flatten it out and fluff it up, well, it made no difference. It was like I used this pillow for a few years, no support at all. You can get a better one at Walmart for five bucks.

This pillow is a joke.  It came rolled up and flattened for shipment.  So I unrolled it and it never regained its shape.  I had to throw it away.  What kind of nut rolls up a pillow for shipment?  Of course that would cause it to go flat and stay flat.  I don't know who would do that but it was a bad idea.

I got this pillow to replace a pillow that no longer kept its structure or provided support. Unfortunately, this pillow from the start was thin, did not keep its structure, and did not provide support. Pillows are highly personal, if you're looking for a pillow that provides support, this is not it.

Was hoping for more. Needless to say these pillows go flat the second your head hits them. I like a soft pillow but with these your head goes right through them to the bed. They also do not hold their shape so they look bad when the bed is made.

Bought two batteries. One worked for a year. The other didn't work at all out of the package. Unfortunately, I didn't get around to testing the 2nd battery until the 1st one stopped working. I'm currently stuck with two bad batteries. Will need to find another company that sells 'tested' products that work.

I'm pretty disappointed in this product. I work in the food industry so nothing is worse then coming home and having hands that smell like onions even after wearing gloves so when I found this I thought my life had been saved, I was wrong. Although it's a great concept and I know there are other products similar to this that work, this one did not. I've tried it many different ways and it still just doesn't take away the smell. :(
summary: I'm pretty disappointed in this product

reviewText: It's not that bad of a cart, I was just wanting and needing a bigger one. It wasn't the easiest to put together either, but it seems sturdy enough once you do get it together. I would like to return it though since it is doing me no good. I ended up building my own cart.
summary: I thought it would be bigger

reviewText:
As others have stated, once you get this thing assembled, you cannot move it while it's full of laundry supplies.  The metal welds break very easily, it cannot support the weight of more than one bottle of detergent on each level, it doesn't roll easily and it will fall apart.

You cannot lift it, you cannot roll it, you cannot nudge it.  It will fall apart.

After dealing with the piece of garbage for far too long, it finally fell apart on me for the last time.  Into the trash bin it went today.

This thing is a piece of junk.  I couldn't get the wheels installed. In addition, in order to get the shelves attached you must have two people, one to hold each side piece somewhat slanted so that the third person can hook the shelves on. I put the idiotic thing back in the box and returned it.  I was trying to save money so that is why I bought this cheap thing.  I guess you get what you pay for.

The entire contraption is held together by tension, there are no screws, or even hooks. It held together for about an hour, and that was it. i crazyglued the joints after that, but i haven't really looked at it since then.

This is not Pinon wood!!!  I lived in New Mexico and know Pinon wood, nuts, and everything else about the Pinon tree and this is not what I paid for!  I am going to to communicate with Amazon that someone is trying to make a profit at their expense.  This is not even close to Pinon wood.  The wood bark is wrong and there is no scent.  Pinon has a very distinctive scent but this does not even come close.  It might be oak, which I am pretty sure it is, but it is not pinion.

Save your money and do NOT buy these shoes.

For the first few months they were wonderful. They fit perfectly, felt good, and were soft and pliable.

But I made the mistake of leaving them out in the garden.

If you leave them outdoors, they shrink. Yes, as incredible as that might sound, if left outdoors, these garden shows will get so small, you won't be able to use them. (I'd rate these with no stars if I could!)

One of the valves arrived defective and doesn't  open enough to create pressure... of course there's no way to return it without completely dismantling your system. I would buy the parts separately so that you don't run into the same problem.

I've owned this for 3.5 months. I really enjoyed using it to mist my plants. It worked very well. That is until the ring you put your finger through to help push down the plunger broke. Now it is an awkward two handed operation. I would like to buy another one, but it's not worth the money if it only lasts 3.5 months.

The cap doesn't stay on very well and since the handle is on the cap and the pressure of the plunger pushes the bottle away from the cap it's not uncommon for the bottle to shoot off and hit you in the foot!
summary: The cap doesn't stay on very well and since the ...

reviewText:
I thought this would be great for spraying things indoors because at least it also looks like an ornament but it broke within a few weeks and won't spray any more.

It is actually made cheaply so I would not recommend it to anyone who actually wants to use it.

I've returned two Glimour oscillating sprinklers to Lowes because of poor craftsmanship.  I returned the first and picked up a second one thinking I'd just bought a defective unit.  Well both were.  The mechanism that switches the direction of the sprinkler head malfunctions very quickly, rendering it useless.  I would not spend another dime on a Glimour sprinkler product.

I decided to ignore the people who rated this sprinkler poorly and draw my own conclusion.  Sorry I didn't heed their warnings.  It worked great for about a month and then became stuck and wouldn't turn at all.  I actually thought I'd done something wrong.  I tried everything but to no avail.  All it did was sit there and click when it tried to turn.  I threw it out.  I wasted my time and money!

I was disappointed with this purchase. The seller did not provide the proper case. The rosary was supposed to be in a case that had the picture of St. Therese as shown in the picture.  Instead the case had a picture of the Holy Family.  I am returning the item and have ordered the same item elsewhere.

About a year ago, we purchased a memory foam pillow from Wal-Mart.  Though I don't remember the exact price, it was fairly inexpensive.  My wife and I both really liked the pillow, so I decided to get another one.  After going through numerous reviews on Amazon, we decided on this one.  What a disappointment.  It wasn't nearly as nice as the much cheaper one from Wal Mart.  Neither of us uses it.

The glue was so thick that it would not come out of the bottle. I opened the bottle up and applied the glue with a toothpick. I ended up with a gooey mess which then hardened and ruined the item I was trying to repair.
summary: The glue was so thick that it would not come ...

reviewText: got fooled by the infomercial. It probably doesn't work any better than any other glue.  I used it on a throw pillow that's opened at the seams.  It takes a while for the glue to really adhere and even 24 hours later or a week later if I barely pull at the seam, it'll come right back apart.

Despite knowing the dimensions prior to ordering, this product still ended up being too big for any of my kitchen drawers. To top it off, it would cost nearly half of what I paid to return the product so I'm kind of stuck with it. I was really looking forward to using this product to organize my spices but now I'm just disappointed.
summary: I was really looking forward to using this product to organize my spices but now I'm just disappointed.

reviewText: The blanket does not really get warm. It is barely warmer than a conventional blanket -- and sometimes I think that the warmth is only in my imagination. The USB cord is not very long, even with an extension. Every time I move my chair it pulls and I have to disentangle it many times a day. It is pretty with a fluffy cover (navy) and the size is nice.

I bought this last year for my wife at Christmas time. It's getting cold again and I asked her how she liked it. She finally admitted it never worked. It's too late now to return it. I just tried to get it working and didn't have any luck. So, live and learn. We let the dogs sleep on it now (without the heat).
summary: It's getting cold again and I asked her how she liked it. She finally admitted it never worked

reviewText: The overall quality of my experience with both a pellet and then a wood stove from US Stove is that they are simply poorly made and that the company makes a great deal of money off of the price of their parts. And you have to watch to make sure that the stove you order hasn't been "gobbled up" by the giant that calls itself "US Stove". They may make stoves but I got burned in a different way than expected. Heck, robbed is more like it.
summary: NEVER buy a US Stove Product

reviewText: This is not worthy of even one star!  DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT.  IT DOES NOT STICK TO ANYTHING. The reason is not because of the surface(s), but it is because the metal covers on the suction cups hit the surface before the suction cups, thus not allowing the suction cups to work.  I am not returning because I threw away all wrappings it was in, thinking that there was no way that this simple gadget wouldn't work.  Amazon needs to take this off their product offers.

It is described as "fog free" and it doesn't even come close to being fog free. The product description also says "2 super strong suction cups....". Whoever wrote this description either hasn't ever tried to use this product or is in serious need of a dictionary as this product does not stay suctioned to a clean glass surface.

It doesn't work. It doesn't stick to any surfaces no matter how much I clean them or how hard I press into it. And yes, I've been trying to apply it to the correct types of surfaces. Total waste of money

Came out of the box with only one working suction cup. The right cup seemed to have been creased at some point during packaging so that it doesn't seal against the tile no matter how hard you press. I ignored the problem when setting it up because the left cup seemed to hold it up just fine.. for about a week or so. A cannot give a good rating to a product that isn't fully functioning straight out of the box!
summary: I ignored the problem when setting it up because the left cup seemed to hold it up just fine.. for about a week or so

reviewText: The hooks aren't shaped right to hold a razor.  The razor just ends up twisting sideways and falling out.  Maybe it would work with a disposable razor, but I have a Venus razor that is a bit more hefty.

When I received this product, the first thing I did was remove the plastic protection. Upon just gazing at myself in the mirror, I felt dizzy. Why? Well this mirror is wavy, kind of like a fun house mirror. This is not something I want to use in my shower. A mirror should not be wavy. I'm truly disappointed in this product and I am returning it.

I feel foolish for not taking the picture literally.  The mirror really is blurry as the picture shows.  It's not a mirror in the sense that you are thinking.  I found out that if I smear soap on it, I can see my reflection; but that is just extreme.
summary: I feel foolish for not taking the picture literally. ...

reviewText: Horrible product. Complete waste of money. One of the suction cups seems to work only when it wants to. The mirror isn't even a mirror. It's just a piece of metal that gives me a blurry reflection of myself.

"Fog Free" and "POWER LOCK" is a complete lie.  I just received the mirror today and already, the "POWER LOCK" has broken on the right side.  I could not get it to stick in my shower and the right side suction cup seems to be bent all around making it even more difficult to suction to the shower.

I am not happy with this product and really hope the company who makes this thing can fix it before anyone else has the same problem as me.

NOT IMPRESSED.
summary: Horrible. "Fog Free" and "POWER LOCK" is a LIE!

reviewText: "Fog Free" is just plain not true about this mirror. It's incredibly foggy, and I can't see my own face from two inches away while shaving. I do not recommend this product at all. The suction cups fall off of the wall, the razor balances precariously, falling all the time. This mirror is so faulty it's not functional and I strongly recommend buying a different brand.
summary: I do not recommend this product at all

reviewText: It sucks, it is the worst thing I have ever bought. What ever you do, do not buy this piece of crap. I bought one it didn't stick at all, so I returned it and got a new one, well this one does the same thing, piece of crap!

I was not happy with this product at all.  It was certainly not fog free and I could not get it to stay on the shower wall with the suction cups.  I ended up throwing it away after becoming frustrated.
summary: InterDesign Forma Power Lock Suction Fog Free Rectangular Mirror, Clear

reviewText: This thing is horrible!!! Don't buy it! It doesn't work. Coins end up in the wrong slots, they fall into the mechanism itself, jamming the whole thing. Hinged doors to access the coins get stuck. Overall, this is a terrible piece of junk and I regret buying it!!!

These containers are exactly as described... and are made out of hard plastic. For the price, however, there's not much to complain about in that regard. You get what you pay for with this product.  However, when my containers arrived one was split along the seams. It was obvious that the damage was due to transport. I contacted the seller but never received an acknowledgment from them. As a result, I decided to post this rating here... and plan to leave feedback on the seller page as well.
summary: Came damaged, No response from seller

reviewText: Ok...I get it that you get what you pay for. HOWEVER, I wouldn't give five pennies at a garage sale for these. They are SUPER flimsy. One was busted and unusable when it arrived. I will attempt to use these once and then throw them in the recycle bin. I would recommend just buying the heavy paper coated ones like this. They are cheaper and these won't be able to be used for very long. Plus, they are so cheap they probably have BPA. Wouldn't surprise me.

When I purchased these I thought I was getting a tub that was 8" high. As soon as I opened the box I could tell they weren't the right size. Sure enough the product description has contradicting info. One section says 6.5" the other says 8".

Deceptive packaging / labeling.
this bag is so small it will fit in the palm of your hand. How dare it say 'BIG' on the label. Very deceptive.
This will not come anywhere close to filling a real bean bag. I estimate you would have to buy between 100 to 150 of these things to fill a real bean bag.

I have purchased this product through stores quite a number of times at stores and was always very pleased with results but this time I decided to buy it on=line because of the price. BIG MISTAKE!!. Previously, this product always came out of the bottle a dark brown color. The stuff I bought on line is light brown and barely seems to have any effect. I can't decide if it is old, diluted or just plain fake. I will never buy from this vendor again!!!

I used this product one other time with minimal results but I gave it another try just to see if I did something wrong. I didn't, this product just stinks! I applied max strength to a small area and it's been a week now and the weeds are still there.

I bought this for my wife as a gift. She did not like it at all. The "essential oils" smell horrible and cheap. The colors are terrible. And when you add all the ingredients, the texture is not something you would want to take a bath with. It's lumpy and gritty. Definitely returning!

I was looking for an air freshener without a strong scent and thought Neutral would be tolerable.  It's not at all unscented but has a strong fragrance.  I can't tolerate it.  I guess since they couldn't come up with a name they called it neutral but don't be fooled, it is a strong scent.

This is a great idea, unfortunately they don't work. Got them in and tried them out on several bottles of wine. They fell off of every one of them.

The magnets are far too weak to hold the weight of the collar.

It seemed like such a great idea for bottles that are too large for the regular size collars that I have. Unfortunately, when I went to pour the Champagne the collar just came apart and fell off the bottle.

After mounting these decals which, by the way, look like more like Halloween decorations, I was sitting at the table and a large blue jay flew right into the window, not 3 inches from where the decal was placed. He survived, but I am NOT happy.
summary: look like more like Halloween decorations

reviewText: I was trying to save a little space and better organize my kitchen, so I ordered these magnetic spice containers. Unfortunately, the magnets glued to the bottom of the containers are so weak they slide down the side of the fridge when they're *empty*. If actually being magnetic is something important to you when you're shopping for magnetic spice containers, these aren't what you're looking for.

This is such a ripoff!  When I got mine in the mail the instructions said it only worked with PBR or Miller Lite!  I tried to fill it with my favorite craft beers and it wouldn't work. What is that about?  I couldn't even get it to take Heineken.  I am going to try to get my money back!
summary: Only works with PBR or Miller Lite!

reviewText: I ordered a THREE (3) divider laundry basket...do you know what I recieved?  A SINGLE (1) opening "folding" laundry basket that is for KIDS and has a cartoon character on it! SOOOOOO not what I ordered.

Save your money.  This is very cheap (like all these pop-up hampers), but unlike others, as soon as this hamper starts to rip, the whole thing is useless, because it needs to be able to hold these 4 little tubes in place to stand up.  I bought other pop-up hampers, and they have ripped a bit, but they're still usable.  This had to just be thrown out.

I don't know what the hell is going on with Amazon lately, but this is like the third or fourth order from them that has been messed up for me. I ordered this laundry hamper and when it came, it wasn't even the same hamper. It's literally a blue laundry hamper that says "All Star" on it with a bunch of sports balls on it. It's from the Innovative Home Creations company, but it is NOT what I ordered.

This, as others have said, is junk! It is made out of the cheapest, weakest plastic available. But it might be usable if I hadn't tried to take it apart before use. After that, it never went back together. The plastic is the kind that will not slide and the two pieces need to slide together to make a whole cylinder. I can see  that once it got cold, there would be no way to get it apart. It is not worth any price. Please don't waste your money!

This seems like a good idea in theory, but doesn't work in reality. The meat sticks to the hard plastic in the freezer, making it nearly impossible to get the patties out of the container. If the discs were made of flexible plastic (like the top), this would work.

4 out of the 6 pens did not work, they were like dry felt pens, I couldn't even get a line out of them to check the color. There is also a no return policy on this product which I found out only when I tried to return it. Don't even think about wasting time and money on this product.
summary: If you're looking for dry felt pens that don't work - you've got it!

reviewText: If they didn't cost more to return them then they cost in the first place, I would have sent them back. By far the worst thing I have bought on Amazon. The only place they belong is in the garbage. You couldn't match a color to save your life. I am sure I would have better luck with some crayons.

I had one of these for nearly 20 years using it occasionally. When the faceplate on that one broke, I replaced it this one. I got maybe 3 uses out of it and the faceplate broke on this one too. It doesn't have the durability needed for pasta. Maybe if you follow their measurements that make the dough softer by using so much oil that it doesn't even taste good. I do not recommend this one.
summary: Maybe if you follow their measurements that make the dough softer by using so much oil that it doesn't even taste good. I do not

reviewText: I owned the original version of this model over 20 years ago.  The first one I received broke the second time I used it.  It's replacement lasted a few months longer before it suffered a major malfunction.  It's sounds like this new version is just as bad as the original.  As they say, "you get what you pay," but in this case probably not.
summary: The latest version is just as bad as the original.

reviewText: I used it 1.5 times before it just stopped working. The first time using it I noticed cracking and creaking sounds like the plastic was under serious pressure and could actually see it moving and twisting. Figured that wasn't a good sign. I tried it again and that was the end. It just turned off never to be turned on again. I am so upset because I was super excited about this purchase.

The fabric is made from toxic polyester (esters of dihydric alcohol and terpthalic acid) that off-gas toxic chemicals every time it is heated. These toxic chemicals cause cancer, metabolic syndrome, unexplained weight gain, persistent headaches, birth defects, decreased IQ, skin problems, autoimmune conditions and many other conditions. It's the same thing as the new car smell. Avoid it!
summary: The fabric is made from toxic polyester (esters of dihydric ...

reviewText: This is nothing but a set up of flashing lights... It does nothing to deter any rodent or insect... They can walk right by it, it might even attract them... Looks nice as it flashes the lights and oh yeah it has a NIGHT LIGHT... The only function that really works....

The hose arrived in a box that looked like it had been crushed. The hose had 2 kinks in it. The hose doesn't fit my sink faucet. So it's of no value to me. And rather than pay for a return it was promptly dispatched to the garbage can.

Bought this product this year as I didn't want to have to replace nozzels this year [It's better to buy the entire portable misting system which gives you 5 at $12 than it is to buy 3 nozzels at $9!]  Didn't make a bit of difference.  The nozzels still clog up at about the same rate they did last year.

Wick lasted only for 3 weeks of use.  Complained to the manufacturer and I was told they can't honor the warranty because  the defect was water related. Isn't the  wick supposed to be in contact with  water/moisture? I don't recommend this product.

Something isn't right with this filter.  The original one that came with the humidifier lasted 4 Months.  This new one is a little over a month old now and it just stops working.  I noticed last week that it wasn't emptying the water as well.  Now it's just not working at all.  Don't buy unless you want to replace these things every month.

They only last a few weeks. If you remove it for cleaning, it is like a wet noodle, and you can't get it back in the unit. If you let it dry before putting back in, it will no longer absorb water, rendering it useless. Save your money.

What you receive is not what's listed. You receive a different brand, shape, material, and size. The bottle on the left in my photo is what I received. The bottle on the right is an actual Winco brand bottle. Much better quality and the lids are not interchangeable which drives me crazy.

I should have looked closer at the description but this pillow is tiny!! It looks absolutely ridiculous!! It could be used in a playhouse but that's it. Guess I'll save it for when I get a playhouse.... Totally bummed
summary: I should have looked closer at the description but this ...

reviewText:
These coals suck. They are the worst coals I've ever seen. They will not light at all.
I will leave them on my gas stove for 5 minutes, in the hottest part of blue flame; nothing.
I'll soak them in lighter fluid, then leave them on the stove. Fluid burns out, coal still not lit.
Then I tried using a butane cigar lighter, and they still won't light.

Do not buy these coals. Trying to light these is like trying to set a brick on fire.
summary: Coals suck. They will NOT light, even with lighter fluid and after sitting on a gas stove for 5 minutes

reviewText: I bought two bags of these. They were vacuum sealed upon receipt. I opened a bag, immediately took what I needed and resealed the bag with a foodsaver. The bag did not return to the vacuum sealed state, nor did the absorbers get warm. The other bag had the same result. Do not buy these. I use oxygen absorbers frequently so I know how to use them.

For some reason these aren't working for me.  The packs of absorber do not feel hard like they would if they were spent, but they aren't warming up like they are activating.  I went so far as to leave one out overnight and there is absolutely no change in it whatsoever.  Good thing I didn't do any large scale food preparation or I would be going back and redoing all of it.  Grrr...
summary: The packs of absorber do not feel hard like they would if they were spent

reviewText: Looks good. Good size. But upon arriving one of the caps didn't even screw in. The threading was threaded so I couldn't screw it tight and could pull it out or it could fall off at any time. Don't waste your money. Spend a bit more and get something that's actually well made and airtight.
summary: Not airtight at all. Doesn't even screw shut.

reviewText: Overpriced piece of paper. Huge disappointment. At least NOW they've changed the description to let people know this is a cardboard cutout, I'll be sure to read reviews from now on. This was a waste of time and money.
summary: Overpriced cut out. NOT a figurine.

reviewText: I wish I knew how to contact this company. I think this is a good product, however, it's not supportive enough for my back. It might work for some, but for me it softened up too much after a few days and now I wake up with pain in my lower and middle back. I'm hoping the 5lb topper might be more supportive. So far there is no way to contact this company to find out. If they had better customer service, (or any really) I could give them more stars. No phone number is listed on their website.
summary: Not working for me & no contact # for company

reviewText:
The mattress arrived on time and in good condition. I was surprised that it didn't come with a cover.  I was able to use it for 2 years in my RV and was very pleased with the product.

Unfortunately, I could not recommend this mattress because after about 2 years it separated in the middle. I couldn't believe my eyes. It just broke apart. I read in another review that it did the same thing to that person.

I bought this iron after the one I had for 13 years stopped working. I loved it at first. It ironed really well with little effort. I have now had this for 8 months. If you put water in the resevoir, it leaks all over the clothes from under the metal plate. If you do not use water at all, it does not get the wrinkles out of the clothes. I used to love Black and Decker, but I am starting to wonder if they even make a quality product anymore.

Fits the car just fine, but my travel thermos rattles around in it and is totally unstable. Waste of money, and unreturnable to boot. I realize it's not a lot of money, but this is not a solution to the problem at all.
summary: Don't waste your time or money...move on.

reviewText: This was totally useless.  You might as well set a cup on your dashboard.  There is nothing to hold it securely in a cup holder. Total waste of money.  It makes everything even more top-heavy with nothing to grip the existing cup-holder.

Disappointed. Won't buy it again. If you need to remove brown or rust colored stains, this product barely makes a visible difference. It does slightly improve the general appearance of the book. If you need a bit - a very little bit - of a brightener, this is an OK product.
summary: Got brown/rust colored marks to remove? Keep looking.

reviewText: I bought it mostly for the look and it does look nice, but it doesn't really work for playing music.  I wasn't expecting great sound, but the sound of this player is horrific!  We literally burst out laughing when we tried to play it for the first time. Now it's pretty much just a joke when people come over and ask if it plays.

The first delivery I received was defective; the plastic pegs lacked the internal threads, making assembly impossible. The replacement unit I was given was missing four screws, so Ill have to make a trip to the hardware store just to finish assembly.

Build quality is of the cheapest imaginable, and I really don't expect this desk to withstand one year of light use. If you're in the market for a new budget desk, youd best look elsewhere - and don't get suckered by the low price.
summary: Poor build quality if you're lucky to receive all materials

reviewText: For the price, I didn't expect this to be a fantastic piece of furniture. That being said, I certainly didn't expect one of the tubes making up the legs to break cleanly off at the end when I started twisting it into the cap that attaches it to the table top. The plastic was extremely flimsy and brittle, and one of the surfaces was scratched up despite padding. I won't be purchasing furniture from this brand again.

I bought this as a temporary desk for a guest. It was so embarrassingly cheap and wobbly that I just threw it out. I ended up buying a metal one for about 70 dollars at a local computer store.

I do not recommend buying this. Save your money.

I ORDERED THIS AS A GAG GIFT AND PAID ABOUT $35. THE PILLOW LOOKS MUCH BIGGER IN THE PICTURE, BUT WAS VERY DINKY WHEN I GOT IT. THE SHIRT IS THIN AND THE PILLOW IS MORE OF A CHEAP BEAN BAG. TERRIBLE QUALITY FOR THE PRICE I PAID! IT WOULD'VE BEEN GREAT AT $10 WITH FREE SHIPPING.

Do not buy this product; not because it does not work, but because the chipper that it attaches to is not made to be towed. The chipper has small plastic wheels that easily break and will not withstand towing. I had a wheel break while chipping! The tow bar is actually well made, but over priced.
summary: The chipper has small plastic wheels that easily break and will not withstand towing

reviewText: I was appalled to find that the chocolate in this Advent calendar is loaded with chemicals.  I had not purchased a similar calendar in a shop because it was chemical laden.  When I saw these on Amazon and the chocolate was described as natural and gourmet I was very pleased.  Misleading, disappointing and WRONG.
summary: When I saw these on Amazon and the chocolate was described as natural and gourmet I was very pleased. Misleading

reviewText: They shipped a $6 item with a required signature.  We weren't home the first time they tried to deliver it and it got lost in the mail after that.  We tried tracking it down 5 times.  Ugh!!  It's hardly worth it for a $6 item.  Now it's a total waste of money b/c the post office finally located it for us the day AFTER Christmas.
